Reviews.Title: “It was everything and more!”
Reviews.Author: perfectdeb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Regis for 4 nights over the New Year period and it was amazing. We arrived after a very long flight from Australia and were delighted with our exquisite room.( the photos on the website don't do the room justice.) Beautifully decorated and very spacious. Within minutes our female butler was there to show us the facilites of the room as well bringing us a life saving pot of tea! The hotel staff especially the concierge were extremely helpful - booking us a different restaurant every night - including New Year which were all exceptional. I have never had such exceptional service from any concierge staff as here. The location of the hotel is perfect. We walked to all the museums and galleries and you are surrounded by amazing shopping - the subway was around the corner, we actually never took a cab except to and from the airport. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone who wants to have a really exceptional hotel experience where you are treated like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Second time even better than the first!”
Reviews.Author: lindz3
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to visit this gem one more time. We paid in Starwood points and regular good old fashioned do re mi! Our two rooms were adjoining with a private hallway that we shared. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Everything was "clean a whistle"...whatever that means! The showers were both so strong that we were almost knocked over! We never encountered another guest on our floor and only saw one or two other guests on the elevator just once or twice during our whole stay there...this hotel is PRIVATE!!!! We used the complimentary limo service three times and the driver was courteous. It was really fun traveling in high style! They say the driver will only drive you 10 blocks, but that number was very loose... Also, be sure to stop at the Illy coffee shop across the street in the indoor public park area...yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: dtgmichigan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the venerable St. Regis for a one-night business trip in early March. Can't beat the location. Service, as one would expect, was top notch. The obligatory international front desk staff (I frequently wonder whether the staff at hotels such as this are *really* foreign, or just regular 'ol American kids to whom they teach foreign accents?) handled check-in with aplomb. And very nicely walked around the front desk to walk me the very few feet to the elevator. Somehow, I was upgraded to a Tiffany Suite. Not quite sure how that happened. I was incredibly spacious -- long hallway from the front door that led to a separate living room (that could've -- and I'm sure frequently does -- served as its own bedroom. Separate bedroom with a wardrobe that filled one wall. Get this -- *two* full baths, each with double vanity. I had four bathroom sinks at my disposal during my one night stay. I made sure to use all four at some point during my stay (kidding). Two showers, two tubs, two "water closets", etc. An efficiency kitchen hid behind closed doors. Despite its sheer square footage, I'm not a huge fan of the baroque architectural style of the hotel and the room. Very ornate, very "over the top". It is what it is, though, and it's consistent, I think, with the history of the property. My very own butler (or at least one that I was sharing with a few other well-heeled travelers) showed up immediately after I checked in (foreign accent!) and gave me the walk through for the room. The TV in the bedroom was recessed in this piece of furniture at the foot of the bed, so she showed me that. She also brought a plate of fresh fruit and told me that pressing for two pieces of clothes and shoe shine was complimentary. Nice touch, though didn't take advantage of it. My only other comment is a bit of a complaint, and at the time I was experiencing it, it was frustrating. When I returned to the room that evening after dinner, I wanted to turn the bedroom TV on. It was already "un-recessed" from its wooden home, but the power button wouldn't turn the thing on. Kept messing with it, but couldn't get it to turn on. So, I went to the very modern phone contraption and tried to call the front desk to get someone to help me. I was touching the "front desk" button, but nothing was happening. Then I tried to dial the four digit extension itself. While all this was going on, a phone was ringing in a separate part of the room, far, far away. I at first didn't answer it, but then when it rang again, I ran to answer it. It was the front desk asking me if I was trying to call them. I'm sure anyone reading this thinks that I'm just an idiot that doesn't know how to operate either a TV or a touch tone phone. However, when the butler (a different one) showed up, she shook her head, had a wry smile on her face, and said "yes, when they (do something -- can't remember exactly what it was) you need to reset the TV." And she proceeded to lift up a corner of the wooden frame around the TV, hit a completely hidden reset button and the TV worked. I exasperatedly said "how would a person know that?" And she said "you wouldn't, I keep telling them they need to get this fixed". I apparently wasn't the first person to express frustration about this. Then I said "and what's the deal with the phone?'" She said (and I'm paraphrasing) "We have problems with these all the time, I can get you a regular phone if you want..." I said "It's 11 p.m. now, and I'm checking out in the morning, so it's not necessary, but it's just very frustrating for a hotel that is so service-oriented in every other respect". She seemed a bit sheepish about the whole thing and again offered to replace the phone, but I declined. Again, the (human) service was excellent, but the TV and phone system left a little to be desired!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Great Location with Excellent Concierge”
Reviews.Author: William S
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very good. We stayed on SPG points and are gold members, however we were not able to get our upgrade as the clerk said they don't upgrade to JR. Suites. The room was very nice, however I probably won't pay the freight if I wasn't on points. The concierge service was excellent, we utilized several of them on different occasions and they were the best! I even contacted them on future trips we i didn't stay at the hotel. The bar was very nice and popular but had an odd odor. I would recommend but use your SPG points.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic Concierge service”
Reviews.Author: faye b
Reviews.Content: St Regis is everything you expect in a luxury hotel –great service and facilities . What was a pleasant surprise was the friendly , helpful and personalised service of the concierge staff –McKinley, Harold and Maria made our stay fun and interesting by recommending wonderful places to eat, drink and explore. Our 9 day holiday was faultless, mainly due to their expertise.The rooms are well presented and maintained. We especailly loved the walk in robes where we could fully unpack everything. The rooms are very quiet and we had fantasic sleeps during our entire stay. We are returning to St Regis this year for 17 days and we cant wait to revisit all our favourite places and to try new places...with the help of concierge of course!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - But Don't Believe The Hype”
Reviews.Author: ldiggy
Reviews.Content: After many trips to New York, I was finally allured enough by what is considered by most to be the best hotel in New York (if not the US, or the world) and decided to book an (incredibly expensive) stay at the St. Regis. I'll admit that my expectations were extremely high for this property; a result of its exorbitant price coupled with the incredible reputation that precedes the property. The first thing that someone considering staying here needs to take note of is that this property is OLD. There is nothing in particular that is falling apart, dirty, or not up to modern standards, but everything just feels incredibly old fashioned and out of date. I know that this appeals to certain demographics, but for me, when I'm spending this type of money, I prefer a modern hotel with only the most cutting edge aesthetics and technology. With that in mind, I would recommend somewhere like the Trump SoHo over this property, if that's your sort of thing. If you're more into a hotel that resembles an antique and old-world glamour, then perhaps this is the place for you. Positives: -Great, over the top service (having a butler on each floor is nice). -Great location in the middle of Manhattan -Very clean with an attention to detail Cons (for me): -Old and outdated -No pool or other resort amenities typically included at this price point -Poor views from most standard rooms (first night stayed in a room that literally had almost no view, with only a tiny window allowing for a small view of the building next door making it feel particularly claustrophobic).

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but special!”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelCriticIntl
Reviews.Content: This is where you stay in New York when "nothing but the best" will do. It's a special occasion kind of place. Spacious rooms, great service, nice bar, it has it all. I love the library like seating area in the lobby. It is top of the line and really pricey, but a perfect location so you'll save a bit on taxis. You should try it once in your life.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: STEPDI
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in one of their beautiful Astor Suites. Stay this time as enjoyable as on previous trips, great and professional service, wonderful Butler service, an escape of piece and quiet in always busy and hectic NYC. Definitely remains one of the best hotels in the City. The Bar caters mainly to walk-in locals, which is nice, however its not that nice that people are not asked to check-in their overcoats, jackets and big bags, rather than having them hanging on the back of the chairs or all over the floor - even someone had a small suitcase in there with him - it really does destroy the otherwise lovely atmosphere- this is not a bar in Grand Central Station. At times one wonders about the intention of some of the female mainly Eastern European ladies that are not in residence, that seem to be targeting the single male, older clientele. As such, some improvements to the above mentioned and it would make it the perfect place in town.

Reviews.Title: “Classic elegance and luxury”
Reviews.Author: Softlanding
Reviews.Content: The hotel is always good in almost ever respect and the the service is really exceptional for New York, particularly from the butlers. The bigger grand luxe rooms are well worth the higher price, if you prefer more space. The only downside is that the room tarriff can be quite high, even by NYC standards. Fortunately, I was able to avail of the special offer for this month - pay for two nights and the third night was almost free!

Reviews.Title: “Best bed ever”
Reviews.Author: dannyboy10025
Reviews.Content: Slept like a baby in the definitive Lux hotel experience

Reviews.Title: “A bit of Old World in New York”
Reviews.Author: Eddie B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here late last year in one of the St Regis 2 bedroom residences. The residence was about 1100 sq ft and pure luxury. Although very old fashioned, it's still so luxurious and comfortable. The bathrooms are solid marble and the beds are incredibly comfortable. The hotel is perfectly situated beteween 55th and 5th for shopping and restaurants and cabs/towncars are always outside. The hotel staff were incredibly helpful throughout our 8 night stay at the St Regis. Always on hand to book restaurants and theatre tickets for us. If I can ever afford it, I would love to go back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous luxury”
Reviews.Author: sophie o
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous in every way, from the moment you walk in to the moment you leave you are taken care of. The rooms are beautiful with the comfiest beds I have ever slept in. The location is perfect for shopping and Central Park. The trip was a combination of business and pleasure, but it felt like a holiday everyday. I would also recommend that you have a bloody mary in the King Cole Bar, they are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Regal St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: AmyTy
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is one of our favorite hotels in the city. We LOVE the location and often come in for an overnight from Connecticut when we are going to spend the day, have dinner and take in a show. We did just that over Thanksgiving weekend 2011 with my sister and brother-in-law. We had a beautiful suite with butler service and everything was exquisite from our comfortable bed to the wonderful shower. Dinner at Adour was great, as well. Perfectly located for a walk to the theater, Central Park or Fifth Avenue shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: ackz
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 14-year-old daughter, her friend and I stayed at the St. Regis for three nights between Christmas and New Year's Day and could not have been more pleased with the experience. The trip was a combination of business and pleasure, so the location, just steps from 5th Avenue shopping, was a real plus. Our room, a double queen, was large especially by New York standards, with space for a desk, a loveseat and a chair without ever feeling crowded. The butler service for coffee and tea each morning was an incredible treat. Housekeeping kept the complimentary chocolates well stocked, much to the delight of two teenaged girls. Everyone connected with the hotel was lovely and eager to assist however possible. The concierge desk in particular was very responsive, offering many alternatives to each of our inquiries. For example, a strap on one of the girls' shoes broke. The hotel offered to send it uptown to their repair service, which would have incurred courier and taxi charges in addition to the repair. When I hesitated, he also told us about a shoe repair shop located in in the subway concourse two blocks away; we dropped the shoes off on our way to the train and picked them up at the end of the day, solving the problem easily and inexpensively. I would love to return to this beautiful hotel on my next trip to New York!

Reviews.Title: “It's an excelelnt hotel”
Reviews.Author: BirdsandBay
Reviews.Content: It certainly is an excellent hotel and everyone was so nice. The place is immaculate and beautiful....but I am hesitant to say that paying full price of $1000 a night is worth it. We have stayed at other hotels just as nice for a lot less. I don't need a butler. This is a historical place and it's beautiful during the holiday season. Right on Fifth Avenue. The decor is a bit much for me -- the fabric crown over the back of the bed just seemed so odd to me. The furniture in the room is fairly ornate but yet the table on the side of the bed are simple and are covered with fabric. But everyone is perfect there -- nice folks, great attention -- but you're paying for being treated well.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: barolobrunello
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two nights using Starwood points. I've stayed here three or four times before, always on points. We were upgraded to a slightly better/ corner room. Everything was great. The common areas were neat and well decoated, the room was clean, the bed was incredibly comfortable, and the service was outstanding. I especially appreciated the free in-rooom coffee service each morning. I would never pay the usual rate of $1,000+ per night, but it's a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: vacationgoer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a quick weekend stay at the St. Regis and were very impressed. He's a Starwood Platinum Preferred guest and we used points for the room. Although we weren't upgraded, we were still very happy with the room. We thought the rooms were a decent size (given it's NYC) and loved the beds! The location doesn't get any better, the butler service was fantastic (took advantage of the tea/coffee service, shoe shining, pressing our clothes), the gym was great, and the concierge was very helpful (great restaurant suggestions!). We weren't able to utilize the house car since it's first come first serve and it was already out but the door staff was happy to flag a cab for us. We tried to have a few cocktails at the King Cole bar but were told that they were full. Maybe next time? Each employee went above and beyond to ensure we had a great visit. Hopefully we will stay there on our next trip to NYC! TIP: 55th can get quite congested and being a one-way street, can cause difficulty in getting a taxi. I would make sure to plan ahead if you have reservations and either pre-arrange car service or request a taxi ahead of time since it can take some time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful High End Hotel Experience, Though Astor Court could use some work”
Reviews.Author: rbneuronyc
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the St. Regis for a one night stay to celebrate our anniversary. We were personally escorted to our floor where our butler met us and took us to our room. She unpacked our bags while we went out to dinner. We wanted to stop off at the the King Cole bar first, but couldn't get any where near either a seat or the bar as it was very busy, so we went out to the Astor Court to get a drink. The service there was simply terrible. It took about 10-15 minutes for a waitor to come and take our order, and he was scarce after that. The room itself was wonderful, and had a blend of old world decor and high tech equipment. A push button screen allowed us to contact our butler at any time. I wish the buttler would have taken more time to explain the equipment, but she was always available later. In the mornng I called for coffee, and the buttler brought me a French Press pot of freshly made coffee and my shoes that were shined the night before. The room itself was nice and while not large, larger than many NYC rooms that I have stayed in. The bathroom was nice and and well equipped. The fitness center was complementary and had nice equipment and we had no trouble getting a machine. Locker room was small but adequate and had a nice steam room.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Decadent”
Reviews.Author: ksellers_11
Reviews.Content: Very impressed by my stay at the St Regis NYC. The hotel itself is beautiful, from the masonry on the exterior to the old world charm of reception area. As New Yorkers are not known for their charm I wasn't expecting much hospitality from the staff but to my surprise everyone was extremely friendly and helpful for the duration of my stay, especially the concierge who was able to get us several extremely difficult dinner reservations at Daniel and Per Se with a moments notice. The rooms are very spacious, utterly luxurious and have the largest bathrooms i've ever seen in NYC. Many of the rooms come with a dedicated butler and are packed with high tech devices like an lcd pad that controls everything from the rising tv hidden at the foot of the bed to calling the butler to mood lighting and surround sound control. The hotel also gives its guest full use of a chauffeured bentley within a certain distance, which was probably my favorite amenity. The restaurant recently opened by Alain Ducasse is excellent as well. Of course all of this came at a tremendous price but i have yet to find anything that is reasonably priced in new york. I highly recommend this hotel and hope to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible experience.”
Reviews.Author: ttot11
Reviews.Content: I was blown away by the elegance and class of this hotel and its amenities. The price for the hotel is steep, but worth the splurge. I recommed this hotel to everyone who travels to NYC not traveling on a budget. One of my family members had their wedding reception here in February. The food, service and rooms themselves were above and beyond all my expectations. The rooms are opulent and the beds and pillows are top notch. What a great nights sleep! The hotel in located in mid-town, centrally located to everything in NYC. Nicest hotel I've ever stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it so much we got married here”
Reviews.Author: RoomRaider69
Reviews.Content: After our third date in the King Cole bar, it was only inevitable my wife and I would get married here. What I didn't expect was how many of our friends and family said it was the best wedding they had ever attended. Just one of many stories I heard: a vegetarian friend asked for an alternative to the filet mignon and lobster, and the waiter whispered that he could get her whatever she pleased. "That made me feel so special to be here," she said. Seriously, what service! The meeting and event staff here were the most professional we encountered among the event staff at the top NYC hotels. They do hundreds of weddings a year and have a formula that works brilliantly. When I went to wander the floor a few hours before the reception, everything was in place and all details had been attended to. We went to the church with no worries. The reception was mind-blowing. We made a last-minute switcheroo on the menu, swapping in a lobster salad appetizer. I figured it would be a few chunks of lobster. No, it was the whole tail. Alain Ducasse's restaurant oversees the catering, and it was everything one expects of the great chef. The ever-present St Regis event planner ensured that the timing of the food with the dancing was perfect, everyone was served almost immediately, nobody's wine glass was empty (I negotiated a price inclusive of all food & alcohol--didn't want to feel $150 poorer with every pop of the champagne cork), and I was told later that even the staff seemed to be having a good time. The butler service was essential for me. We sent them a bunch of last-minute dry-cleaning (tuxes, etc.), asked for a bunch of room service, and had them running a bunch of errands to track down this or that. The important thing to understand with the St. Regis is that this is the anti-Waldorf-Astoria among the Guilded Age hotels. Col. Astor realized 110 years ago that his Waldorf-Astoria was inevitably going to be forever filled with hundreds of tourists gawking slack-jawed at the lobby and built this hotel as a quieter refuge. Unfortunately Col. Astor died on his honeymoon shortly after building the hotel. Shortly after getting back safely from ours, we made the reservation to spend the first anniversary here.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for New York but not one of the great hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: Brantwood52
Reviews.Content: I stayed Monday to Thursday ( three nights) in early November for business. The hotel itself, the gym, bar, amenities are all very good and the location is excellent. However it just didn't have the same "wow" factor that I enjoyed when staying at some other top hotels in other cities including the St Regis in Singapore a few weeks earlier. I did use the complimentary Bentley just to try it. However it is more of novelty value as it only goes 10 blocks and my meetings were mostly in the 12 to 20 block range. Within 10 blocks I would always walk in any case. I gather it is mostly used for advertising value. Having it go 15 blocks would be far more useful as it would get to 42nd street and upper east and west sides. The internet performance varied a bit and was not working for a prolonged period of time when I needed it. Bell desk was great. Butlers were not as proactive as some other hotels but did everything requested so no complaints. But no "wow" - that is exactly what I needed being offered. Bottom line is that New York hotels are different. The base cost of simply operating in a good location with good size rooms is so expensive that there just isn't the budget to be great and still fill up occupancy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic upgrade to an amazing suite on a points stay”
Reviews.Author: Mactoki
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my Wife on a mini break to the city. I splurged 30,000 Starwoods points for a night here but it was well worth it. When we checked in the desk guy was very excited that we had been upgraded to a St. Regis suite (probably because of my Platinum status). The suite normally costs $2.5k a night and we could not believe that we got it for free ... right on 5th Avenue. The suite was incredible, 2 full baths, a massive living area and a huge bedroom. All beutifully presented with some very cool features like a TV at the end of the bed that moves up and down when you are done with it. The room came with a 24hr butler (that we didnt use in the end) and the guy from the front desk gave us a personal tour of the hotel. We had breakfast in the room which was kinda pricy ($108 for two) but hey...we were feeling rich :-) Eggs were cooked to perfection. We had an amazing nights sleep thanks for the very comfy bed. Thanks St. Regis!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel and location on earth”
Reviews.Author: mymannick
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 4 times and have always looked forward to our next visit with great anticipation. The location could not be better, it is extremely quiet for nyc and the rooms are extremely confortable, it feels like you are staying in a castle not a hotel. The service we have received has always been superb, especially kristel in the front office. The unpacking and packing by the butlers is an excellent service which we always use. The king cole bar is one of the best hotel bar i have ever seen/been in. The service of the concierge, bellmen and doormen is always friendly and helpful. We have stayed in over a dozen nyc hotels of all calibers and by fsr the st regis is not only our favorite but by far the best. My wife loved the spa and the room service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The location is perfect...”
Reviews.Author: cyn m
Reviews.Content: ...the rooms are very nice with amazingly comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “ST REGIS THE ONLY HOTEL I WILL STAY IN NEW YORK CITY HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: diann w
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the St. Regis for over 20 years. I have brought practically every family member to share this beautiful property. I actually want some of my ashes put in one of the planters outside the lobby entrance. I am not royalty..and have seen many digtinguished guests over the years..and believe me, I am treated like a Princess. The rooms are lovely..and the beds luxurious...I have all of my beds in my home St. Regis Style! The Concierge, ALL of staff members, are the best any hotel has to offer. The doormen, Matt and Jimmy...you welcome me with open arms every time I arrive. I feel as if I am "coming home." The Butlers are wonderful...and never fail to accommodate your needs. And..the King Cole room servers are courteous and attentive. Michael is one of the hardest working servers I have known for years...always good to see him! I could go on and on....the best thing to do is make this property your choice of Hotels while in NYC...you will not be disappointed with the staff, service or ambiance. I love it! Diann Wilson

Reviews.Title: “Good not great, particularly given the price”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_Michaela
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is a good hotel: - Rooms are quite spacious (particularly by NY standards) and well-appointed - Location is an excellent starting point for an up-market, touristy experience of Manhattan - Old-world style and decor is charming However, given the cost, none of the above is that exciting. In fact, it's expected. The one distinguishing feature of the St. Regis, as I understand it, is the service. Much is made of the butlers in particular. However, we found the service to be very hit-and-miss: - The butler on our first night was polite and attentive, and provided a nice enough overview of the amenities, complimentary services, etc. - Then I called the butler on the morning of my second day, as I needed to know a number written on a business card I had left in the room. Instead of graciously helping out with this simple request, this butler grunted and protested her way through the request, sighing and muttering loudly as though I had asked her to benchpress the bed or clean the Aegean stables. I've experienced friendlier service at hostels. - We also informed the hotel in advance that we would be celebrating my birthday during the stay. They acknowledged this by email before our arrival, but absolutely nothing was done while we were there. I've been offered chocolates, champagne, dinner reservations and more when celebrating my birthday at other hotels of a similar calibre - at the very least, a card would have been nice. All in all, the Regis is a good, old-world NY hotel. But for that amount of money, you can have a better night (and better service) elsewhere - and buy yourself dinner and theatre tickets with the change.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marie Cecile H
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is a top hotel and the service is superb, from the moment you arrive. It is an oasis of luxury. The butler on your floor always seems to be right there when you need him. The concierge, front desk, bellmen, et al were all wonderful. The room was beautiful and had fresh flowers.Thank you St. Regis for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Calm, Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: Folkgroupie
Reviews.Content: This stay just about completes my 5+ star hotel stays in New York and I had the best, comfortable sleep and butler service beyond any other hotel in the city. They truly check on your needs. I love the soothing luxurious decor. Truly a sanctuary if luxury ,

Reviews.Title: “Luxury awaits!”
Reviews.Author: shooflyfarm
Reviews.Content: We have been going to this hotel for a few years now. Just about everything in this hotel is designed to make you feel comfortable. From the car check to the Butler on each floor. This last time, I stayed there because we were stuck in the city for the night. We checked in around 1:00 in the morning. We were immediately upgraded to a suite without asking for it. (we are starwood platinum) Most hotels make you beg for your promised upgrade. The room was clean, stocked and beautiful. Too bad we checked in so late. The beds there are amazingly comfortable. The linens are changed 2 to three times a day if used. I walked in after a perfect elegant breakfast the next morning and the housekeeper was changing the bed I was about to sink into. Truly, the beds are wonderful. The bathroom is the best in the world. I have never had a better shower. I love the products they have there. Great selection of movies, In the heart of NYC. We didn't realize it but we were there on September 11 and there was a parade going on all day. We were treated very special and were helped in getting the best information to get out of the City without problem. We didn't get much time to really enjoy the Regis this time. We usually go in around 2 or 3 in the afternoon and have so much time to enjoy the room, service, the complimentary Bentley and driver, the best location in the world and we spend a fortune! It's extravagant and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Girlfriends”
Reviews.Author: swaffy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the St. Regis for 5 days in late April with a group of girls. We had a two bedroom suite shared between 4 of us. It is a beautiful hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Disappointed B
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money. For a seven star rating from star woods, I would not say it's any better that a 4 star hotel. The hotel room was nice the staff offered to help with the bags and you get free fruit in the room. Other than than, for seven star service first they put us in the wrong room, switched us to a room that smelled liked smoke, couldnt move us because the the hotel was booked, they brought us the wrong bags, we called the butler they never came, we did not even see the butler for our floor. It was also our anniversary, I brought a nice bottle of champagne and chocolates. Being our room was not ready I snuck away from my wife and asked them if they can place it in the room on the cover table with champagne glasses for when we get.it. They literally placed the champagne and chocolates on the coffee table in the back I gave it to them in. There was not set up whatsoever. Again don't waste your money go to another hotel. I am also saying this as a platinum star woods member.

Reviews.Title: “Great AfternoonTea Experience”
Reviews.Author: MAO424
Reviews.Content: Had a delicious tea service with amazing tea sandwiches that were expertly explained by our server. It is a beautiful place, building, room with charm and an air of quiet elegance. A haven from the helter skelter beyond the realm of their doormen. The cavernous bar (The Old King Cole Bar) next to the restaurant rotunda is an historic bar with a beautifully restored Maxfield Parrish mural of Old King Cole...slightly mesmerizing to sit and watch over a cocktail or champagne, as we did after afternoon tea and a tour around the lower levels of the hotel. We did not stay overnight as hotel guests, but spent a relaxing afternoon here enjoying the food, the tea, cocktails and restrained elegance.

Reviews.Title: “King Midas would stay here.”
Reviews.Author: nrhdkk
Reviews.Content: If you have a need to satisfy your inner King Midas, you could do a lot worse than staying here. Excellent staff, first rate cuisine, spotless premises and large well appointed rooms. A personal butler is there for you. The concierge is very much on top of things in NYC. All of this comes at a high price, so we go every year or so. You are within walking distance of the MOMA, St. Patrick's Cathedral and Central Park. Excellent reataurants and the theatre district are there for those so inclined. Taxes and high prices abound, but if you have a good pre-theatre dinner and go to a first rate musical comedy, it's a New York weekend. Take a 5 mile walk during the day and view the passing parade.

Reviews.Title: “Setting the standard of what a 5 star hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: bmwminirc10
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife and newborn..service service service!!!loved it set my 3 month old baby up with a crib even gave me diapers baby shampoo ect.Hotels very elegant and you get the kind of service fit for a king .Fyi the bloody mary was invented at the st regis nyc and they make a great one.Old school architecture with modern day amenities makes you feel like your in the early 1900s when the astors first made this hotel love!!

Reviews.Title: “Certainly some positives but overall a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ACKACK1313
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 5-6 times, typically during the Christmas holidays. This time we came over the summer for a quick weekend trip. I'm a Starwood guest, so my preferences are high floor, outside room, not right off the elevator...if possible. We're accomodating, and I don't expect all or even any of these to necessarily happen, just requests. Problem was: our first room had a flickering light in the closet, very annoying and no way we'd be able to sleep in there. It was like a strobe light. We left for an hour, it couldn't be fixed. Second room (after an hour), was.... right off the elevator, thermostat didn't get cool, a room we had before and didn't like (and requested not to be in). Then we waited in the lobby for an hour, 10pm, with our bags packed, sitting there. The front desk people have no autonomy to give out rooms, we had to wait for a "manager" who I guess was busy for an hour. When she showed (11pm), we got the lowest floor, inside room, no apology, etc. We didn't complain. Not a huge deal. Just for $800 a night we'd have liked better... maybe an apology, an upgrade (which I offered to pay for, didn't get it either free or paid for), anything. By the way, third straight time we had add-on minibar expenses we didn't use. To be honest I've paid it in the past because I didn't want to complain. This time I made them take it off since I got over-charged basically for my stay. On the plus side: our inside 5th floor room was comfortable, they gave us a car service to the airport unexpectedly which was a pleasant surprise, (PATRICK, THE GUY WHO STANDS OUTSIDE-- IS AWESOME), nice concierge. Overall, Mandarin is pretty nice at the same price. Can't really let guests move rooms 3 times then sit in the lobby for an hour, and not offer them something, even when they'll pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Will206
Reviews.Content: This is a very traditional hotel - I typically prefer something more modern, but the rooms are huge for New York (bathroom alone was bigger than some other hotels I've stayed at in the city), clean and well appointed. Service is great without being obtrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Upscale Hotel”
Reviews.Author: newguest
Reviews.Content: Here is an old world hotel with lots of charm and amenities for a price. This is definitely how the wealthy enjoy a weekend or longer in NYC. If you can afford it I recommend a weekend during the winter when the city is decorated and festive. This hotel is classy with butlers who are available with a call day and night. You pay for service and service is what you get from the moment you walk into the lobby until you leave. The restaurant onsite is very high end but the King Cole bar is affordable and an institution. If you enjoy an "old fashion", Manhattan or any of the old school cocktails these bartenders do them all justice.

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: KWG1625
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis for three nights in May and were fortunate to stayed on our friends points. The rack rate for the room was $1,000 and the only really upscale feature was the oversized walk in closet. The shower doors had rust on the frame and the door into the separate toilet would not close properly. Now at an average hotel this wouldn't be an issue but for the "money" it was a disappointment. The doormen and concierge were outstanding, maybe the best I have ever met, and the hotel bar was fantastic. The two restaurants were a disappointment also, again considering the money. We have stayed at the Sofitel on 44th? and the Hilton at Times Square and they are about of third of the price and much better value.

Reviews.Title: “So very forgettable...”
Reviews.Author: BochanTraveller
Reviews.Content: There really isn't much to say about the St. Regis. Yes, it's a hotel. Yes it has rooms. Yes those rooms have beds. Yes it has bathrooms. Yes those bathrooms have showers. Yes there is marble in the lobby. Yes the staff are helpful. Yes... Are you asleep yet? I'm sorry. It's just that three weeks after checking out, I've forgotten everything about the hotel. It was just so... average. Bar the fantastic breakfast (though no buffet - pah!), there is absolutely nothing that either lifted this hotel up, or dragged it down. If it were a colour, it would be mid-grey (appropriately, the colour of our room). I would complain about the price - the published rates are very very high (and in my opinion very very not worth it), but I received a discount from my travel agent that brought the cost down to (you guessed it) average. So, if you want a thoroughly average 'luxury' hotel, the St. Regis will do just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: aspenlocal
Reviews.Content: We managed to get away from the kids and stayed at the St. Regis in April. We booked through jet luxury resorts and ended up getting a residence room (larger room) than a normal room at the best price we could find. The stay was fantastic with 24 hour butler service and all. We had wanted to stay at the St. Regis for awhile, having always heard about it's old school charm. The hotel didn't disappoint. We stayed three nights but could have stayed much longer. Great service, great room, great location! Would highly recommend this hotel and jet luxury resorts to get a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: dba80
Reviews.Content: Service the way it should be... Seen and not heard. No problems with guest rooms or restaurant (Astor Court) of any kind.

Reviews.Title: “Iconic property, flawless service!”
Reviews.Author: Leontraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The St. Regis NYC from June 17-22. Being this our first time visiting NY as a married couple, we couldn't have stayed in a better place - the building is beautiful and, literally, at the best location in Manhattan, we could walk everywhere! The check in process was quick and extremely friendly, the Butler seems to "magically appear" when you need him/her, complimentary coffee was provided in the mornings and it was delightful, housekeeping service was seamless and consistent every single day. Their overall service is top notch and always anticipative - one day I left a half a bottle of white wine on the counter in the small ice bucket that is in the room, when we came back at night they had placed it nicely in a wine bucket with ice, a "small detail" but so insightful - when we came back to the room at night we had a chilled lovely bottle of wine! Details like this make the St. Regis so amazing. The King Cole Bar was great as well as Alain Ducasse, their signature Restaurant. We dined a lot around the city and again, everything is walking distance from this marvelous hotel. Kudos to all the exceptional staff at the St. Regis New York and hope to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “BRING BACK THE BARTENDERS!!”
Reviews.Author: nyc1176
Reviews.Content: I can't believe the St. Regis is actually going to keep those three great bartenders away! Myself and my friends and business associates will not return to the King Cole Bar until the St. Regis hires them back. We would spend literally thousands of dollars a week at the bar and now we will take our business elsewhere. I always thought this was the BEST place in NY to get a drink but it's just not the same without them. I hope reason prevails!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: kaceevh
Reviews.Content: Loved the St. Regis, truly beautiful. One of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in, wonderful staff, lovely rooms, excellent location for shopping, walks in the park, shopping... Pricey, but worth it. Would definitely love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: InternationalAhole
Reviews.Content: I live and work in Manhattan, so I normally don't get the pleasure of staying in NYC hotels, but for work purposes, I was put up in a very luxorious suite for one evening and was very impressed by all aspects of the hotel. First, the lobby is really special and intimate, the staff was very friendly....and the room was spectacular. The beds are the most comfortable I've stayed anywhere in the world...similiar to a cloud! The television is huge (although does require some help to turn on...or maybe that's just me!) and the bathrooms are fully stocked with my personal favorite, Acqua de Parma....The location is unmatched...you're between Madison Avenue and Fifth Avenue but away from the Times Square tourist madness....and you've got lots of nearby lunch and shopping options. This a great hotel for those who can afford such luxury, don't hesitate!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.....”
Reviews.Author: ehhensley
Reviews.Content: You can't deny that the St. Regis NYC has an incredible location, but I have to admit, I was expecting a little more as far as the service quality. I chose the St. Regis because as a Centurion card holder, they are always recommending the St. Regis brand to me whenever I book through Centurion directly. We stayed in the Grand Luxe room facing a brick wall, which was a little disappointing seeing that my guest was a first time visitor, but then to come home from a wonderful dinner in Gramercy, yes at the Tavern and to find that there was not even turn down service was quite disappointing. Apologies were given, but at 11P, I don't want two people in my room turning it down, which was what showed up when I made the call to the front desk. On the second day, we came home at 4 o'clock in the afternoon after a long day of shopping on 5th and the room hadn't even been touched. Another total disappointment. I didn't mind paying the 800.00 a night, but really didn't get the value from it. One last thing, which I thought was quite ridiculous. On the last day we had lunch in the Astor Court. I understand that hotel food prices are always astronomical (27 dollars for a club sandwich), but come on now--9 dollars for an iced tea??!! When my bill came and there was two iced teas for 18 dollars I had to laugh out loud. And let me tell you, Pasquale does not have a sense of humor!! That, St. Regis, is quite ridiculous. All in all, I will probably stay at The Peninsula across the street when I am in town in two weeks eventhough it's not a Starwood property.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: DontPanic42
Reviews.Content: This was not my first stay at the St. Regis. I read a couple of reviews here recently where the hotel had slipped a bit and from my perspective nothing could be further from the truth. My only suggested improvement would be a thinner comforter for the bed during warmer months. I was a bit too warm in bed. Other than that, the front desk, room service, bell staff, chambermaids, butlers and concierge were all very accommodating and polite. A truly excellent hotel. This is now where I stay when in New York.

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable hotel bed!”
Reviews.Author: haryun
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis NYC is perfect. Comfortable rooms, great service, great dining options and a great bar (that is home to the first bloody mary).

Reviews.Title: “Will NOT RETURN unless Bartenders come back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sarasota69
Reviews.Content: I must first say I love this hotel. Actually, I grew up in it!! I lived in Trump Tower most my life and was a regular at King Cole Bar! My parents and grandparents were regulars.I probably spend a thousand a week there. The day that I found out Quako,Gavin and Mike were fired it actually felt like a DEATH! I could not believe this was over something so minor. Where is tradition for the St. Regis? These men dedicated most of their life to the ST.Regis and there customers. Now, the regulars who include billionaires,celebrities and etc...have come together and will not return to the Regis until the guys come back!! The Four Seasons (who sent us gifts baskets) are really happy to have us!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance refined”
Reviews.Author: Confettigirl77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful- you feel like you have stepped back in time when you walk in. I want to praise Angela at the front desk. We arrived early and our room wasn't ready. She promised to call when it was, and she did. She was very kind, polite-great customer service. Butler service was amazing- was greeted in my room shortly after check in and was offered coffee or tea. Sadly, we had to leave early in the morning so I didn't have a chance to use the concierge services or eat at the resaturant or bar, but next time ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Where did the old St. Regis go?”
Reviews.Author: RadioTraveler
Reviews.Content: Ah, back in NYC and for an extended time (but not long enough to need an apartment at The London) so here we are, again, at the good old St. Regis NYC. Since my last stay was pretty much a service disaster I thought for sure the first thing they would do when I arrived for a scheduled two week stay was to ensure everything was great. Not so much. During my last review, back in January, I made a point of telling you that I choose this hotel for stays such as these for any number of reasons, but primarily for service. I booked this stay myself so I know what I asked for (not myself really, but through AMEX Centurion concierge) and I know what my travel advisor made clear. Problems with room availability happen and it is not the fault of the hotel if a guest (or many of them) decide to extend their stay. When that happens I am more than happy to spend many of what my friends spend in rent a month for each night in a suite here. Why? SERVICE. Unfortunately, again, the St. Regis let me down. PERHAPS I could have made clear that walking into a room that reeked of pine smell from cleanser was not something that was necessarily the St. Regis welcome anyone would be looking for (and it's not like we arrived early); MAYBE I could have expected that the room would have been ready (and by ready I mean clean with regard to vacuuming up the schmutz left on the floor by the previous occupants of our room (or do I really need to tell someone that candy wrappers not eaten by me are not decorative?); I certainly could have asked that I not have to go through my luggage for toiletries (you come to expect things like soap, shampoo, and body wash in a hotel - especially when you are checking in and going directly to a Passover Seder); AND MAYBE it was a request of a high order that when hotel employees are walking down the halls before 5a.m. that they turn their radios down so that I don't have to wake up hours before I need to. But I guess I should have. The best part was room service (something you would think that after my last experience with room service here they would have been on top of), but that too needed correction. My boyfriend was hungry so we shared a midnight omelette made from egg whites (we're gay - you didn't expect yolks did you?) and when the food arrived, quite timely, we were treated to an omelette without anything in it. Essentially what we got were egg whites that looked like an omelette, but had no filling. It was insane. I called down to get it corrected and, well, they apologized and about 15 minutes later new ones came (with TWO delivery men) to make sure they were okay. The addition of 1 ingredient makes an omelette. But NO INGREDIENTS? Why bother? All in all the first night at the St. Regis here in NYC has me wondering where the old St. Regis went? It is still there in the butlers and door men (except the one that can't seem to keep off his phone from texting, but he was doing that the last time so I hailed my own cab to synagogue), but something is missing. MAYBE it is the fact that they are pretty full (that could be it, but surely they anticipated large crowds for Passover); PERHAPS it is that things just fall through the cracks - OR, more likely, the St. Regis is going by way of so many landmark NYC hotels and becoming more like the Waldorf? I stay at a hotel for service - nothing more. Everything else can be fixed. What I don't expect is everything to require fixing so soon into a stay. I only hope the old St. Regis returns before I leave next week or this will be my last stay at any property with the name for this, the flagship, should be the best and it is slowly losing that distinction.

Reviews.Title: “My first choice”
Reviews.Author: elfion
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis continues to be a standout among many hotels in New York City. I am a ten year Starwood Platinum member. I have stayed at all the Starwood properties in NYC and at many of the other 5 star hotels in the Big Apple, The St. Regis remains my first choice of New York hotels. Everyone that we encounter appears to genuinely want to assist . From the doormen and bellman to the hotel operator. I have stayed here many times and have always experienced excellent customer service. My last stay was March16, 2011 for two nights and this stay was no different. The wheels of the car are just about stopped when the door opens and we are warmly greeted back by the doormen, Pascal and Jim, who guides us up the steps to the lobby. We arrived early and although our room is not ready, we have been upgraded to a suite. Thank you St. Regis and Starwoods. As we had previously arranged to have afternoon tea in the Astor Court waiting for the suite was no problem at all. I would like to add, that if you enjoy high tea this is the total experience. If you do not try the Astor court for tea you are doing yourself an injustice. Before tea was over we were found by the front desk clerk and handed our keys. The suite was very nice and with a powder room, very convenient. Housekeeping somehow cleans without being seen but does a great job. We ordered room service for dinner, although good, I think going downstairs may be a better bet. The delivery person could not get out of the room fast enough, and the table set up suffered. We think he may have rushed because he was alone in the living room with my girlfriend while I was in the other room, this happened on two occasions. Dinner in Adour is a sublime experience that should not be missed. Excellent in every way. There was one experience where I was taken aback. When checking in the butler comes to your room and introduces him/herself and will bring you a coffee or tea set-up that is complimentary. Well, upon check-out I noticed a unknown charge and was informed that was for tea. I explained that I never saw my butler when I checked in and I received the tea the next day assured on the phone I would not be charged. I was told very curtly that they will make an exception this time but that it is not customary. When I reiterated that my butler never showed up the attitude became condescending and again was told just this once they will make an exception. I thought she may have apologized that the butler never showed up, never happened. Not a big deal but again unexpected at the St. Regis. I love this hotel and already have a booking for this summer. This is a hotel that should be on everyone's bucket list.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, very private hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindz3
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many fine NYC hotels ( see my past reviews) including The Penninsula (several times) The Plaza, the Ritz Carlton Central Park (several times) and have always wanted to stay at the St. Regis. We used over a hundred thousand Starwood Points to stay free in a Grand Luxe Suite for four nights. We had a lovely experience. Paulina at the front desk was helpful and generous. The concierge, Mckinely (sp? ) was helpful and relaxed. The doormen and even the guard man were just as nice too. This hotel is set up so that one can remain fairly anonymous ( two celebrities were there who I spotted duck in out--- but I am observant and also tend to spot stars when others whom I am with remain oblivious). The room was quite dark , but it was a welcome respite to the hubbub on the street. I can't say that the room was the finest ( no place compares with the Peninsula) but it was really very, very nice. We had a sofa, chair, desk and two full size beds. My husband and daughter thought the beds were comfy--- but I like a bed that doesn't jiggle at all. The bathroom was generous and very clean. The only part of the hotel i would avoid is the restaurant(I forgot the name but I am referring to the less expensive one)I liked this hotel a lot and would be very, very pleased to have the opportunity to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Not the same place”
Reviews.Author: PA_Bank
Reviews.Content: I returned to St. Regis New York after 1 or 2 year’s pause and I am sorry to say but it’s not the same place. I’ve stayed in this hotel over 50 times during the last 15 or more years and I used to dream about coming back to this place. I used to compare other luxury hotels throughout the world while I travel to this one as a standard of luxury. I come to New York for work and pleasure all the time and I am Platinum Starwood with many years of luxury hotel experiences. Check in: The Asian lady at the front desk is not professional and quit honestly just rude. I felt that it was a Holiday Inn. Room: The rooms are beautifully appointed as usual but it hasn’t been maintained in a while. The carpets are dirty and dusty. The bathroom needs caulking and serious cleaning. The wallpaper is torn. The sheets are worn and need to be changed. Room Service: Took almost an hour at night and 40 min for just a single coffee in the afternoon. Check out: The bellman never showed up after few requests so I took my own bags down. No big deal but this is St. Regis ! A category 7 hotel ??? Front desk again, there was one other customer in front of me so I waited and waited and then just left as I couldn’t wait any longer. So, bottom line. I am going back to Four Seasons or Ritz since this isn’t the St. Regis I remember or expect.

Reviews.Title: “The one and only true St.Regis property”
Reviews.Author: Branton
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a rare piece of history. it's the original St.Regis. All the other St. Regis properties are just fake. The NYC St.Regis set very high standars and staying with other St. Regis properties is not comparable. Best Location in town, best staff. best feeling!

Reviews.Title: “A special place to stay in the heart of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: MainlineGirl69
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this lovely hotel over New Years. Has a fantastic restaurant inside, and within walking distance to everything. The bed sheets were soft and luxurious. The marble bath rooms were very clean, and also large. Valet very prompt, as well as the valet. there is a fee of $60 ish for parking but you can go in and out. Love it. French Press Coffee when you arrive. (must request)

Reviews.Title: “Where am I?”
Reviews.Author: babasNYC
Reviews.Content: I came to the St. Regis for drinks with my friends and we were very graciously seated in a stale lobby between King Cole and Adour. We came at 4PM, drinks were dissapointing, with poor quality food, and heavy poor on the booze, but the matre and the servers were taking care of us. They recognized the birthday at the table and sent over a glass fo champagne for us. After a month, I asked for my check to be sent back to me, as I needed to get reimbursment, and it took me 2 months to get their F&B Direcctor, who seemed to be brushing me off as if I was bothering him. He dismissed me even after 2 communications with him, and I told him I was asking for 2 months. This person's service was so dispicable, that I feel the need to write this review. If the hotel people read this, David, whatever his name is, gotta go. I got better service from my cab driver, local bodega guy and pretty much everyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: knocky11
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the St. Regis hotel before and the experience is always good, you can’t beat the 5 star service and location off 5th Avenue, but this time I decided to stay in a residence room that was offered to me through Jet Luxury Resorts and it was really nice for the same price. The residence rooms have more space- they truly feel like a home. And a vintage, elegant one at that.

Reviews.Title: “St. Regis NYC lost its way”
Reviews.Author: RadioTraveler
Reviews.Content: I rate my hotel experiences based on a few key factors: service & cleanliness. I'm currently at the St. Regis and wanted to write before my issues became stale. The hotel is beautiful and historic. No question. It is a St. Regis and I would expect nothing less. But when you get beyond the beauty of the lobby, the initial, superficial, cleanliness of the room, and the size of the room (NYC is notorious for small bathrooms, but that is not an issue here) - you end up with the reality that like flying in America today, hotel stays lost their exclusivity. Good: location, bell staff, front desk, and butlers. They do what is expected of them and check-in was very friendly is my welcome back each time I return. Only complaint about the door man would be he became "star struck" by someone and as I stood in a snow storm the other night he moved this person in front of me for car service. Bad: Room: beautifully appointed and what one would expect. The "smart" controls in the room do not work - so bad are they that the butler had to re-set the phones and the bedroom one has an alarm clock that keeps going off at odd hours. I've taken to using my cell phone and calls from my assistant in CA (yes, 3 hours earlier). Cleanliness: when NYC closed the day of the 12 JAN I decided to take a bath. I did so and as I was getting out of the tub to go the shower I noticed that there was something dark and sticky on the tub. It was not clean and I bathed in it. I got an "I'm sorry," but how horrible. Before someone checks into a room it should be checked completely - not haphazardly. Painfully, I must tell you that if I didn't need to pack up and move myself, I'd change hotels. Room Service: two orders; two mistakes. Not big deals, but if you cannot get an order 100% correct at this hotel you should not be in the hotel business. Another "I'm sorry." After I was done eating I called for the butler (technology coming next) and nobody came. I moved the dirty dishes to the living room powder room to get them out of the living room. I had to get the poor butler to take them this morning since nobody showed last night after I called the operator since I could not use the phone to call for the butler and the e-butler app on iPhone got no response. Concierge: FAIL. I needed two things from them. A massage for a friend and I (I used e-butler to request it) and the next day I heard from them and by about 1:00 they were still working on it. Huh? The concierges at the St. Regis could not find two male masseurs to do the massage for my friend and I? We ultimately went to the Peninsula after I suggested that instead of waiting to "hear back" from their own spa. The best part was me being told, "you could always call..." I could call? Isn't that what you do? Technology: Both phones in the room are not working. The butler has to have the engineer to my room today. I cannot dial the butler, cannot set an alarm, and cannot control the lights or anything else. You literally have to walk around the room and turn lights on/off manually. Do you know how many lights are here? This hotel is among the best and their accolades from other members of the media and travel groups are wonderful. But the practical reality is that I am not getting the same service that I would get at the Four Seasons. I did not stay there because they did not have the room type available that I wanted. Staying here is not a disaster, but I come to hotels for service. I'm not getting it here. What I am getting is a lot of "I'm sorry" and I'm growing quite tired of them. I don't suggest you stay here if service is what you want. If you want to say "I'm at the St. Regis" fine, but if you are looking for something special and a real St. Regis experience - head to Orange County and go to the Monarch Beach. They do it right and not a single I'm sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: Blakely69
Reviews.Content: St. Regis is a wonderful hotel with luxurious rooms that have old world style but modern conveniences. I, personally, feel it is best suited for a romantic weekend as opposed to a place to go with friends. (although it is great either way...just more "fun" properties in the city for the latter) The staff from bellhop to butler are, for the most part, friendly and amenable. Highly recommend for couples.

Reviews.Title: “So many reason I keep coming back...”
Reviews.Author: leetlesasa
Reviews.Content: Great service, lovely rooms, delicious food, of course! And the having Starwood status to get comp upgrades doesnt hurt either :) Great location in Midtown East, perfect for shoppers! Front desk always lets me check in early (quite a few hours before check-in) and I can leave a keycard at the desk for the boyfriend with no problems. The rooms are spacious and have such comfortable beds and linens. This was also the first stay where I've gotten good mobile reception in the room without having to stand right next to the window, hah I have to say this about the room service. Aside from prompt delivery and the food always tasting fresh, it is DELICIOUS. My favorite room service, really. I booked St. Regis for this trip knowing we wouldnt leave the hotel and probably even the room for dinner (I wanted to be comfortable & lazy before a looong flight to LA and beyond) The boyfriend is amused by the power my stomach holds over my mind, but who can complain about lying around in bed in your PJs, eating delicious food, and watching a movie?? The only tiny issue is that I had to call three times (twice after the initial call) to have a bellman come get my bags - and it took nearly twenty minutes. Other times they've been very quick, and I wasnt in a rush so it wasnt a big deal, but just wanted to mention it This and NYPalace are neck & neck as my favourite NYC hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just exquisite”
Reviews.Author: csolheim
Reviews.Content: I find myself somewhat surprised at how delightful I find the St. Regis. As a general rule, I am slightly freaked by over-guilded and heavily romantic decoration. But somehow the rooms feel genuine, charming and even light. The staff members are amazing; helpful and eager to help without seeming servile. They seem to be like their jobs and to like the guest. To be fair, I am Platinum in the Starwood Preferred Guess programme, perhaps they are not quite that friendly with all guests. Still, it's just a splendid hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely property...”
Reviews.Author: adrianasmom
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying here...As expected, the rooms are very clean and have beautiful French detailing and crystal chandeliers. Feels very romantic and tucked away-very old world style perfect for a couple. The lobby is somewhat small and dark, but the rooms and the service make up for it. Butler service wonderful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend retreat”
Reviews.Author: db2102
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty amazing hotel. My husband and I actually live in NYC, but wanted a weekend out of our apartment (which we just moved into) to get away from the clutter of unpacking and to reconnect. Just to set expectations, we booked our stay through the American Express Platinum concierge, which came with some additional perks, like complimentary afternoon tea, complimentary breakfast, and a tremendous room upgrade to the Madison suite, which was 1,000 square feet of comfort and beauty. We started out day at the spa with a couples massage. They actually screwed up our reservation, but were able to resolve it rather quickly and still get us what we asked for. When we were done, our room still wasn't ready, but to be fair, it was because we got the last minute upgrade to the suite. Afternoon tea in Astor Court was lovely - a word to the wise, you actually get a ton of food, so you won't be hungry for dinner until pretty late in the evening. Our room was spectacular. Two huge bathrooms, a corner bedroom, and a large living and dining area with kitchenette. The bed was probably the most comfortable I've ever been in, so that was very impressive. All the food was very good; very expensive for what you get, but that was to be expected. The only thing that wasn't perfect was the service, though it was still pretty good. Though everyone we encountered was nice and helpful, they were pretty slow, and not always knowledgeable. Location is very convenient to mass transit, as well as shopping and entertainment (MoMA, Broadway, Carnegie Hall, Lincoln Center). For a weekend getaway, it was a truly wonderful experience, very conducive to relaxing and unwinding.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: JamesR36
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here over Labor Day weekend. The lobby is tiny but a true jewel-box, marble everywhere, very elegant and takes you back to a glamorous time in NYC. There are doormen just for the famous revolving doors as well as at least two out front curbside to assist w cabs, luggage, etc. I think we had a standard room on the 5th floor (fronting the street, a bit noisy but this is Manhattan, after all, you expect a few sirens and honking horns at all hours), and it was VERY large for NYC, big for any standard room anywhere. The bed was recessed into an arching alcove, and there was a large chandelier. Furniture is antique French, not my style but still very pretty and high quality. There were speakers in the ceiling for the stereo, I thought this was super (never seen that in a hotel before) and they were high quality. Also, a remote controlled the stereo so I could adjust as needed from bed. I thought this was better than the usual Bose Wave radio on the bedside table. There is a digital control unit for the room on the bedside table, to control lighting, climate, phone, etc. I didn't think this was a revelation necessarily but it was nice to adjust the temperature without getting out of bed. The bathroom was gorgeous, all marble with TWO chandeliers, exquisite fixtures, many towels including true bath sheets (that were all replaced for turndown service, nice) and the best shower in any hotel I've ever been in. The rain head released a true deluge, very luxurious. Despite being an older property I thought the bathroom was spacious and modern, I was pleasantly surprised. There was a separate tub from the glassed shower stall and separate toilet. There are some unique touches here. The china is all antique and a variety of patterns. Absolutely everything was embroidered with the St. Regis logo. There was fresh fruit on china and silver every day placed in the room. Maid service was superb. Room service is delivered by staff in black tie and tails, really! I also liked how you don't sign for room service each time which always seemed ridiculous to me since tip and service charge are already added. Here they just say "is everything to your liking and can I do anything else?" If not they whisk out the door. Charges are on your final bill, as it should be, I loved it! Service was very fast and responsive, sometimes literally in moments (such as when we called to have a room service tray taken out of the room). We twice used the "house car" to get to the subway about 6 blocks from the hotel to get to Yankee Stadium. It is a Bentley, and yes, it was nice. No charge, just tips for the Bell staff and driver. The concierge had good recommendations for me for bagels (Ess-a bagels) and dinner when Adour was closed for Labor Day. I especially appreciated that he didn't just recommend the most expenisve option, JoJo was top notch from a celebrity chef (Jean-Georges Vongrichten) but the most expensive entree was $34. It was super. One conceirge did give us the wrong subway line for the 1st day for Yankee Stadium, it was for Citi Field instead, but I think they may have had the US Open on the brain. In any case we figured it out in the station before getting on the wrong train. The location is great, right in the middle of the best shopping in the World, very close to some landmark buildings (Lever House, Seagram's Building) and Central Park. Tons of top dining in the area. There's no coffee maker in the room. I went downstairs to the restaurant and asked for coffee. The hostess went and made me 2 cups of coffee herself and gave them to me complementary. I guess I could have called our butler but I really appreciated her effort for me. Over all I don't think I could have been any happier. Luxurious with amazing service. Well done!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: CNielsen
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy “old classic hotels” and impeccable service you cannot stay in a better hotel anywhere. The hotel is located right on 5th. ave. with all the luxury shops and Central Park within sight., but as soon as you enter the lobby and more so your room there is a quite and relaxed atmosphere. We had booked an Astor suite for our 4 nights stay. The décor is classic and posh with chandeliers in the living room, one large bathroom and a separate toilet. Service at St. Regis is superb, everyone from the butlers to concierge team will do anything to make your stay as pleasant as possible. I celebrated my birthday during our stay, the Butler had found out and delivered a bottle of champagne to our room - nice move! Unfortunately the Adour restaurant was closed for summer break during our stay so we dined elsewhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Posh, Polished Gilded-Age New York”
Reviews.Author: SF_EXEC
Reviews.Content: Yet another bridge weekend in New York, but this time my partner came along. I had always been intimidated by the St. Regis -- I used to live in New York when I was young and had very little money and would sometimes walk by the entrance on my way to work. Well, thirty years can make a difference -- the hotel is the same (as far as I remember) but from the moment the bellman opened the car door to the morning we left, the staff at the St. Regis were gracious, efficient, welcoming and discreet; they were never intrusive, rushed, overly-friendly or (my worst fear) condescending. Luggage, dinner reservations, check-in and -out, breakfast in the room and cars to the airport were all handled with a smooth efficiency that I think comes with a very well-trained staff that works well together. Now, down to business: I had booked a Grand Luxe room, and was upgraded to an Executive Suite. The room was huge, very traditionally decorated (see pictures) quiet and comfortable. Great bathroom, fabulous shower. The property is in the middle of Upper East Side shopping district, and is more than just well-maintained -- everything from the marble floor in the lobby to the gorgeous flower arrangements (they're sort of famous for those, I believe) to the fireplace in our room was either brand new or lovingly-maintained. We had a butler assigned to us, who pressed some clothes, had our shoes polished and made a reservation for dinner. I don't think we were too demanding, but she always showed up at our door within a few minutes of being called. I think of room service breakfast as a litmus test of sorts for hotels: how quickly it comes, how close to the scheduled time, and how good and fresh the food is. The St. Regis passed this test, sort of as expected: the food showed up, beautifully presented, freshly-prepared and exactly what we ordered (I was particularly grateful that the fresh-squeezed orange juice tasted like it had actually been just squeezed). On Sunday, I scheduled a massage at the spa in the morning. I asked if there was any food, since it was around breakfast-time, and the manager just asked what I wanted to eat, and arranged for room-service to deliver it there. The spa is lovely, although not large -- the same holds for the gym. In short, the St. Regis is a beautiful old hotel that lives up to the promise of elegance, refinement and luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Expectations Not Met”
Reviews.Author: MAXZZ
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 3 nights at this property. This is our 5th stay at this hotel. We booked a Madison Suite and were given a suite with a strong smell of smoke. When we asked to be shown another room, we were told that another room would not be available until "much later" that evening or the next day. When I informed the front desk that such a delay was not acceptable, we were shown several other suites with views of brick walls. Finally, a "Fifth Avenue" suite was made available after one hour of dealing with front desk nonsense. Every suite that we were shown smelled of cigarette smoke. The suite we stayed in, 501, had cigarette burns in the credenza and had dried urine stains on one of the toilets. During our stay last year, the shower was full of mold and it had to be "deep cleaned" during our stay. There was no Iphone charger in this suite and there is no HD television. The kitchen appliances were easily over twenty years old as was the bathroom and its fixtures. Needless to say, the management at this hotel needs to step up. It is not acceptable that this hotel charging in excess of one thousand dollars per night for lodging would have repeated trouble with even the most basic of guest requirements (odors and cleanliness). Despite the first hand knowledge by front desk staff of the issues with our room, there was no response from hotel management during our stay. I would seriously consider staying elsewhere (The Mandarin or the Ritz Central Park) until this hotel gets its act together.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to turn 40!!”
Reviews.Author: Nannarpite
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used 120,000 points and spent 5 fabulous days at the St. Regis for my 40th birthday last fall. I had planned the trip for months and wasn't disappointed. We were given a large, beautifully appointed room with an over-sized bathroom on the 3rd floor, and I couldn't believe how quiet it was given that the hotel is located right in the middle of downtown. The service we received from every staff member was outstanding, especially from one of our butlers, Anna, and the doorman (whose name, I'm sorry to say, I did not get) who had then Bentley town car take us to our restaurant, on my birthday, when he had been unable to hail us a cab. So, thank you everyone at the St. Regis for helping take the sting out of turning 40 and for making the trip so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Pay with Points”
Reviews.Author: EmilyWaugh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Thanksgiving holiday in 2009 using Starwood points. It is an old, elegant hotel, with period furnishings. The hotel is in an excellent location, close to theater, restaurants, shopping, the subway, and directly across the street is a great, inexpensive place for breakfast! We would definitely stay here again, but only using points. It is not worth it any other way, especially taking into account the competition nearby. The rooms need to be renovated (the upholstery looked worn and new paint would not hurt), the non-smoking rooms smell of cigarette smoke and cannot be ventilated, even though the hotel insists they can. Insist on inside rooms. We were originally placed in street side rooms and could not sleep all night long. The bathrooms are great! The beds are comfortable. The rooms are clean (even if they smell like cigarette smoke). Fast check-in/check-out.

Reviews.Title: “How is this hotel #80??”
Reviews.Author: PearlGirl25
Reviews.Content: I recently (as in I just got off the plane) stayed at the St. Regis and rushed to write this review. Let's just start with this: Don't even think about another property in NYC, because this is the closest to heaven on earth in hotel form. From beginning to end, the stay was well worth every penny spent on site. Ok, ok- the room service is pricey- but you're not at a HoJo, and you get what you pay for. I spent this weekend at the St Regis celebrating a momentous occasion and happened to mention it as I reserved my room. Not only did I receive a welcome note and chocolate strawberries from the GM, but it seemed as if all of the hotel staff knew of the celebration too. This examples the overall feeling of my stay: Every detail wasn't too small to be overlooked. The concierge, Peter, was more than helpful securing dinner reservations, exhibit tickets, spontaneous nail appointments and the like and we were grateful for his help. Going to NYC is in itself a stressful task due to the overwhelming amount to see/do and the desk guided us perfectly. We sent some items to be pressed and was pleased that they came back only a few short hours after sending them down. The rooms are beautiful and ample though it was a little difficult to find an available plug in that wasn't in the entry way, bathroom or behind the bed.
