I resolved that this is due to the age of the hotel itself, which also explains the smaller than expected bathroom size. This is the only negative I could possibly point out, and attributes the 4/5 on the room evaluation. Make sure to go to the King Cole Bar, if only to marvel at the King Cole painting, but I would recommend trying the Bloody Mary. Tea service was pricey but also worth a try and the spa was satisfactory. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the St. Regis!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis Hotel over Memeorial Day Weekend. Everything was perfect. The room was gorgeous and the service was outstanding. The hotel is so convenient to everything. My husband got a great haircut and I had a terrific pedicure and manicure in the salon. The spa treatments were execellent too. We ate several eals in the hotel. The food was overpriced but very good. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Next NYC trip, it will be the FOUR SEASONS”
Reviews.Author: tokyolady
Reviews.Content: Over the past four months, I have stayed at the Singapore ST. Regis and at The Grosvenor in Dubai. Both properties had EXCELLENT service, especially The Grosvenor in Dubai. I will never stay at the St. Regis in NYC ever again. The woman at the check-in desk was EXTREMELY SURLY. The waiters at the restaurant were NEGLECTFUL and CURT. Upon entering the restaurant on two occasions, the waiter(s) not only failed to greet you but they actually hid behind the pillars. I ordered a bottle of Moet & Chandon for my mother's 70TH b-day and it arrived AFTER our food. I KNOW GOOD SERVICE. I HAVE BEEN TO MANY FINE HOTELS. THIS ONE DOES NOT CUT MUSTAR.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time, Great location”
Reviews.Author: MichiganCece
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the St. Regis New York. The suite was a good size and very clean. House keeping did a great job and were always in twice a day. The concierge could not be beat, they can do it all! We had breakfast every morning in our room and it was wonderful! Everything was very fresh. I think the location of this hotel is the best in New York, we were close to everything. The only compaint I have is with the butler service, I wouldnt even mention that service in the advertising. We saw our butler the first day and never saw her again, it didnt matter much because her accent was so heavy that we could'nt understand her and she could'nt understand us. We just used the consierge for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Formal Hotel-Well Located with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Flunie
Reviews.Content: I just spent 4 nights at the St. Regis for a corporate conference. Had a really nice time and loved the hotel. It's a very beautiful, formal hotel in one of the best locations in mid-town Manhattan. I call it formal, bordering on stuffy in its lobby and overall decor. Almost Old World European in style, which if you go for that sort of thing is probably not equalled in N.Y. They have butlers in tuxedos on each floor who literally will jump when you call to do whatever large or small task you request. Again, if you like that sort of thing, it's great. Personally, I was a bit uncomfortable with the whole concept. I prefer a less formal approach in decor and service, although the service was impeccable. Had a great experience, but if I were paying my own way, I'd choose something else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: TucHippo
Reviews.Content: Booking through Amex Platinum Concierge Service this was my first visit to a St. Regis (part of Starwood Luxury Collection so got my points too!). I usually stay at the Waldorf in NYC but wanted to try this historic property. The building itself is amazing and one of the best of its style in the city. The lobby is posh, albeit quite small and will not tolerate much of a crowd. Nevertheless the staff were very nice. I appreciated the personal touches of bringing the key around the desk to hand it to you in person, and the offer for assistance with not only luggage but unpacking as well. While I declined the unpacking I did end up calling the butler for assistance with touching up a shirt for a concert that night. Ok - I did feel a bit odd the first time, but the service was so professional and helpful (I was brought some tea while I waited for the shirts - impeccably finished I might add, with tissue in the sleeves and silk links on the french cuffs!). I quickly became used to calling for my coffee first thing in the morning. My room deal (if you can call it that at that price) included a continental breakfast in the main restaurant, a beautiful space off the lobby. It was great, although I thought $43 was a touch steep! I used room service once and it was prompt, good food and beautiful presentation. The room itself was beautiful and equipped as one would expect at this price point - bedding, bath amenities, etc. were superb. The turn down service was wonderful. No charge for small things like bottled water, coffee, etc. A small thing perhaps, but many expensive hotels still nickel and dime you on such things. I used the spa for a facial and massage which were great. The gym is in the same facility - it is nice, but rather small. Additionally, if you are there after hours for the spa you must call the desk to gain access - this is unacceptable and access should be gained by your room key. Overall I loved this property and hope I can stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “St Regis”
Reviews.Author: MartyP4
Reviews.Content: Fantastic... Fantastic.. Fantastic.. Your own butler for your room!

Reviews.Title: “Service and amenities don't mean a thing if the mattress is 20 years old”
Reviews.Author: ScottMinerd
Reviews.Content: Before I go off and nit-pick a lauded and historic 5-star hotel, let me put this in perspective: In 2009 I stayed at a range of other hotels, such as a 2.5-star Hampton Inn, 3-star Holiday Inn Express, 4-star Kimpton resort, and a 5-star Waldorf Astoria resort. I was satisfied with all of them, and slept well at all of them. I'm also from the NYC area, and the St. Regis is about 45 mins. from my house (w/o traffic), so this was only my second time staying in an NYC hotel even though I know the city fairly well (I commuted for 10 years and 4 jobs). I would have given the St. Regis a better rating, were it not for the fact that it took me 2 hours of tossing and turning to fall asleep, only to wake up every hour or so due to discomfort. Granted, I didn't see other travelers reporting this issue, so I'm guessing it was just the bed in my room. I took a peek under the sheets at the mattress and it looked _old_. It was lumpy and too forgiving in some areas and not forgiving enough in others. My wife slept better than I did, but not terribly well (but she can fall asleep most anywhere). As I said in the preface to this review, I've stayed at many other hotels and have never had a major complaint about the bed, so please don't think that I'm a picky sleeper. A few other issues I encountered: 1) A literal turn-off: The lights in the room were on motion sensors. If I sat still for about 10 minutes, they'd all shut off. Only some would come back on when I waved my arms, but the ones that couldn't "see" me would obviously stay off. That's irritating and cheap. 2) Both sinks in our bathroom were partially clogged. In the time it took me to wash up before bed the sink was completely full. It took a considerable time to drain after the water was shut off. 3) The toilet ran. It didn't make noise nor bother me, but it shows poor attention to maintenance. 4) The wired internet in our room didn't work, though the wireless did. 5) The desk lamp would either turn off or it would flicker intermittently. The bulb was screwed in tightly, so I think it was a flaw with the motion sensor that was screwed between the bulb and lamp holder. 6) The in-room entertainment device crashed twice while I was navigating the menu. It took about 5 minutes to reboot, during which time the TV was unusable. It was also ungodly slow such that pushing a button on the remote could take up to 10 seconds to change the channel or move the cursor on the menu. 7) 90% of the staff were absolutely polite and helpful. However we were there for a wedding that was at the hotel and during the wedding: One bar tender made me wait while he wrapped up a personal conversation with another employee (we'd made eye contact as I walked up, so he knew I was waiting). Then he just glared at me until I ordered a drink, and he practically slammed it down on the bar without a word, returning to his personal conversation. At the wedding dinner there was a time where the staff was trading out our dinner napkins for dessert napkins. I had my dinner napkin on my lap, and was talking to my wife. I saw the waiter coming for my napkin so I reached down to hand it to him -- he got there at the same time that I did such that if I hadn't been reaching for it already he would have certainly hit me in my .. ahem .. area with some force. It was very weird, and I'm not exaggerating when I say that he grabbed for it forcefully. Most of the waiters at the dinner were gruff at best, but that guy went to a whole new level of rudeness. (I should point out that I'm generally an easy going and polite guy -- please don't think that I was going around being rude to the staff and getting my comeuppance). Despite the issues enumerated above, I can see how someone would love the hotel if they stayed in a different room and didn't encounter unpleasant staff. As I said, the vast majority of the staff lived up to the St. Regis' claim of excellence. The hotel itself is beautiful and well appointed. I particularly liked the touches of the elevating TV, the hidden electronics, and the room control (lights and HVAC) from the bedside phone/alarm clock/etc. (I am a tech person at heart). Although we didn't make use of the butler's services, she was very polite and seemed ready to help. I only ate at the hotel during the wedding, and in that context I would give the food a low-4-star rating. It was very good, but not great. Also, one amenity that I love to see in a hotel is in-room coffee. When I wake up I like to roll out of bed and have a cup. I don't want to wait for room service, and I certainly don't want to leave my room. Hampton Inns, Holiday Inns, most Marriots (and others) provide this gratis. Yet 5-star hotels (in my experience) prefer to not give you the option. I wouldn't even mind if I had to pay for it, but for heaven's sake, put a coffee maker (or better yet a Keurig machine) in the room. Speaking of which, most hotels offer free local calls and free internet these days. The St. Regis charges $1.50 for a local call (up to 60 minutes IIRC), and up to $9.95/day for internet access. I'm surprised they don't charge for electricity and running water. (I know this complaint is general to hotels of their class, but it bothers me nonetheless). Finally, I'd like to point out that my dad has stayed at the St. Regis numerous times and has always gone back. Since most of my complaints were specific to my room, I'll just leave the reader with this: Request a room change immediately if you're put in 1711.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely LOVE the St. Regis - 5 stars all the way!”
Reviews.Author: leetlesasa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night for a mini vacation on a weekday/night. I requested early check-in... and boy, did I get it (I was in the room before noon!) The doormen were attentive and helpful, and helped with my travel bag. They even brought it up to my room, even though it was a small overnighter Check in was efficient and the clerk apologized about not being able to pronounce my last name. Most people try but butcher it, I thought it was nice that she first asked (people rarely do :) There is a butler service, which is so cool but certainly takes some getting used to lol. I had Barbara, who was just lovely. We chatted for a few minutes whille she introduced herself (she loves people from Texas :) I didnt use her services though I will probably request her next time I stay here on a more business-oriented trip I was in a deluxe room and although the view left much to be desired (It was an alley or something..) the room itself made up for it tenfold. Its so elegant and tastefully decorated. High ceilings, perfect/plenty of lighting, flat panel TV, and an absolutely comfy bed. The bathroom is large, and though it has no tub, the shower head is just amazing - I couldve stayed there for hours, lol. Counter space would probably be an issue if you have a lot of your own toiletries and store makeup/toiletry bags on the counter. The towels and bathrobes are so so soft. Room Service - Some of the best food I've ever had and not just by room service standards. I had lunch/dinner (I was so stuffed from lunch that I ordered several apps for dinner. a "sampler" if you will, lol) NY cheesecake is delicious and the cocktail shrimps are huge, and the sauce is tasty too. The fried calamari is a little salty, but out of the dozen or so things I tried, I'd say thats the only one to skip..maybe. A fellow named John brought up the food once, and I usually am bad at remembering names but he was a friendly guy! I ventured out for some 5th avenue shopping and returned around 6pm. The lobby was busy but it wasnt hectic and irritating/frustrating like the w@aldorf is. I was granted a late check-out at 1:30 with no problems at all (some hotels have flat out said NO, even to an extra 30min) and the clerk at the desk was really nice and helpful. As she handed me the bill she suggested I "button up" since its cold outside. that gesture really made me smile and pretty much summed up the stay for here will I stay here again? in a heartbeat! This St. Regis surpassed my expectations in every way, and I finally found my go-to hotel in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Chain's Flagship in City's prime location”
Reviews.Author: myself-7
Reviews.Content: The stay at this prestigous hotel marked two important family dates. The concierge began to communicate with us by email as early as three days before check- in to ensure that all we needed was there to welcome us. So it was. Soon after check-in we were greeted by our personal butler Lenny at the corridor leading to our suite. This was a spacious room having a separate living room with closet and guest toilet, as well as a large bedroom with a full bathroom and another closet. To our most pleasant surprise, the management complimented us with a bottle of champagne and chocolates. Every day we were given a bowl of fresh fruit, and complimentary tea or coffee served in our room a few minutes after wake-up call. All the satff at the concierge's desk was helpful with excellent suggestions for restaurants, and help with obtaining pre-booking for tickets to major tourist attrations . On new year's eve we had a booking for the special event at Adour restaurant. This again was a wonderful experience. The six course meal was served at the rright pace in time to finish off just before the strokes of midnight, . All present were given a momento for the special occasion besides of course the typical glass of champagne. The live band worked up its choice of music to a cresendo, but was careful to never get too loud and unfashionably noisy. The hotel also serves light delicious snacks at the bar and has a very good restaurant serving excellent food and breakfast. The location of the St. Regis is of course another asset. Set on 55th street corner with New York's famous 5th Avenue, close to peaceful Central Park, and to the unforgetable Rockfeller Centre. Liminous Time Square and all the other elegant avenues are also close by. To me The St. Regis is most defintely the place to lodge when in Manhattan. Besides the

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant stay at the St.Regis Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IsisDublin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the St Regis for three nights over New Years with my partner. Overall I would rate this hotel very highly. It is an old charm type of hotel. I found the all the staff to be very polite and helpful, especially the concierge who always helped us find the things we were looking for and when I got sick during the visit, arranged for the doctor to call me and an appointment with the doctor within 2 hours, which was much appreciated. The beds are heavenly, so snug and comfy! THe bathrooms are a lttle outdated, as I have read in the other reviews but they are still nice and have an opulent feel to them, they are just a little outdated, but the room we had was really lovely. The breakfast room is very charming. Overall, we enjoyed our stay very much and we would certainly go back to the St Regis.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the Regis and stay at the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: lakeshore
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to NY to celebrate my birthday. Our room was around $900 per night. We were paying considerably more than we would have had we stayed at the Four Seasons, which is just down the street, but we were told that this was the best in NY by our travel agent. The hotel has an old New York charm and the location is excellent because you are in walking distance of everywhere you may want to be. The decor in the rooms is elegant, but felt old and dated. The bathrooms were gross. You could tell that they had been done in the early 90s with all gold fixtures. You could barely turn around in the stand up shower and everything just felt old. They badly need renovating. The service could have been better. We ordered room service and the food was just OK, but it took over an hour and a half to receive our food and it was cold by the time it arrived. The butler was apologetic and brought us two desserts, which we really didn't want. We would have preferred if they had just offered to comp the meal for us. The service in the restaurant was shockingly bad when we went for breakfast. Half the time our server forgot we were there, and most were unpleasant and unfriendly. We normally stay at the Four Seasons whenever we travel, we were expecting that caliber of service and accommodation but this hotel clearly misses the mark. We left feeling ripped off and disappointed. Oh and to top it off, the spa is a complete joke. I cannot even believe they call this a spa in a five star hotel. When I went to take a shower the shower stall filled up with water and the steam room was covered in mildew.

Reviews.Title: “St Regis Loosing a bit of luster”
Reviews.Author: tomsportsla
Reviews.Content: I Stayed at the St Regis a few days ago and did not feel the 5-star quality I have had in the past. We payed over $800 for a room and asked for an upgrade and the lady at the front counter said it would be an at least $700 to be upgraded. The front desk managers do not care and want to be right a french lady who I think was the manager was rude and explained to us how she deals with affluent customers everyday. We ended up staying one night and moving across the street to the Peninsula where we got the royal treatment and an upgrade for way less. The st Regis has good butlers and location the front desk needs to be improved and they should care about the customers they have. The rooms are a little outdated but the food was great. I hope someone speaks to the management

Reviews.Title: “The standard you would expect but the price.....”
Reviews.Author: Cdub1
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel....as you would expect from a St Regis. Every amentiy, a butler for your every whim, etc. but it really becomes a question of value. If you are someone who enjoys spending money then stay here--the location is great and the service is terrific....while we enjoyed everything about the hotel I just wonder if we wouldn't have had as good an experience for half the price somewhere else.....

Reviews.Title: “Honestly? For a St Regis, it was very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: nadiahkimie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in St Regis halfway through my trip in NYC. My mum & her husband were on an official trip to NYC and since there was an extra room in the Presidential Suite they asked my sis & me to join them. I must say up front that decor-wise, this isn't my style of hotel. I prefer contemporary, tropical, industrial, quirky designs over the gilt gold old classical decor any time, but decor-wise aside, I must admit I was very disappointed with the overall service at the St Regis. Yes, the rooms were large and comfortable, and the beds heavenly. We had a view of Central Park from the living room and that was very cool. The bathroom was also very large but the shower area was quite small and cramped and poorly ventilated, trapping a lot of stifling steam during a hot shower. I didn't spend much time in the living area but the flat screen tv camouflaging as a mirrored frame was a pretty cool idea. I also liked the toiletries in the bathroom and people-watching in the lobby. But aside from the first Butler (Josef) who was very helpful, the rest of them didn't seem to like their jobs very much. One middle-aged lady butler didn't seem to know how to clear up the dining table properly and breakfast we pre-ordered the night before showed up half an hour late (it was also pretty mediocre). My mum woke up the first morning to find coffee and cookies on a tray and she thought they were wonderfully efficient, until she noticed that the cups were all dirty, the pot was empty and it was actually YESTERDAY afternoon's coffee. When she called the Butler all they said was "Oh, you should have called housekeeping" without even apologizing. Considering they make up the room everyday and there should have been a turn down service in the evenings, shouldn't they notice these things? Plus, shouldn't the Butlers come in to check once in awhile instead of waiting to be called? Frankly after the second day, we didn't see a single butler and a broken glass that was there on the FIRST DAY we checked in was still there on the day we checked out! And they didn't replace used dirty glasses with clean ones. If we didn't wash them on our own, we wouldn't have clean glasses at all. Honestly, for the money one pays to stay at the Presidential Suite at the St Regis (or in ANY room at the St Regis for that matter), this shouldn't be the case at all. I was also shocked to find that housekeeping attempted to poorly hide the bedcovers behind the curtains! I really don't know why they didn't just fold it neatly and place it in the almost empty armoir instead. They also seemed to want to get their jobs done in a hurry and kept hovering outside the room and appearing every fifteen minutes even though the do not disturb sign was on and we kept telling them that there was a meeting taking place and to come back later. Other than that, the tv in the bedroom was actually quite small, and wouldn't come out properly from the armoir. You also couldn't turn the aircond or heating on permanently, it was either on AUTO or OFF, and left the room feeling very very warm during the night while we were sleeping. And on the last night, housekeeping didn't even put the drinking water out at all. I was also a bit annoyed with the much too large bathroom rug that was too thick to allow the bathroom door to open without bunching it up. The lift was also kind of small and very rattle. Probably time for an upgrade or serious maintenance. Oh, and if paying that much money for a room wasn't enough, they charge you for internet too! I've paid $165 for a room in NYC before and got free internet even then! Also, there were issues with the key swipe every single night. Even when we went down to get it reset, it still didn't work! We were so exhausted to go down again that thankfully the adjoining room was open and we went into the suite from there. Now if I were paying $100 a night and had to deal with these issues, I would understand, heck, we wouldn't even have a butler in the first place. But I have stayed in cheaper hotels with better service! And like I said earlier, for a St Regis, these issues should not happen at all. And I have been lucky enough to accompany my mum on some trips and even in China the butler always comes in to check to make sure everything is alright and the room gets a full cleaning the minute everyone leaves and is in tip top condition when we get back. That is not to say that everyone in the hotel was a horror though. Some of the concierge were very helpful and one guy even pulled up an extra chair in a lobby for me after he saw me standing for an hour waiting for the rest of the entourage to arrive. Some of the guys out front were also pretty good conducting the arrival of guests, traffic and bags. Other than that, I do think the hotel needs a bit of an upgrade. It could wait a few years or so, but "old" as opposed to "classical" is the first thing that pops into you mind when you step inside. And the fact that the recent reviews I've read here praises the hotel's services makes me doubly disappointed that we did not receive the same service.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: forgetdomani
Reviews.Content: We visit NYC twice a year and always stay at the St Regis. It is incredible. The service is unparallelled; the rooms are large; the bathrooms luxurious....I could go on. Even the workout room is great, albeit small. My only complaint is the bar is overpriced but that's the going rate in the area. Have champagne delivered by the concierge and enjoy it in your fabulous room!

Reviews.Title: “I've got a butler!!??!!”
Reviews.Author: HiEndTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis for 3 nights with our young daughter. I mistakenly booked the htoel for the wrong three days. (I arrived one day early). The professional staff quickly accomodated us with the same rate. We were happily surprised to be greeted at our room by the butler! The room was formal and beautiful. The beds were extraordinarily comfy and my wife said it was like "sleeping in a cloud." The bath products that were provided were spa quality. My wife used the spa and said it was one of the best spa experiences she had ever had. Room service was quick and delicious. The hotel is centrally located - and right across the street from the Disney store - which was the thrill of my daughter's trip. It wasn't cheap, but well worth the expense.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Accomodations, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: CarinM
Reviews.Content: I was on a trip looking for sites to hold business meetings in New York City. Everyone at the St. Regis, from the front desk to security to the housekeeping and butlers were friendly, helpful and went out of their way to provide anything I requested. The rooms were spacious (for New York) and quiet and the sheets on the bed were Pratesi. What more could someone ask for? Oh yes, they also provided butler service.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: AdaminDC
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the St. Regis on several occasions and had a wonderful experience each time. The guest rooms are spacious, quiet, well decorated and functional, with comfortable beds and big marble bathrooms. Public areas are elegant. The staff is cheerful and professional. Room service is prompt and the food is tasty. Ideal location. Overall, a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “CLASSIC NEW YORK !!! FIRST CLASS ALL THE WAY”
Reviews.Author: TinsleyDreamWorksSKG
Reviews.Content: Another one of my favorites. Beautiful hotel and first class service all the way. Great place to have a business meeting as well. The suite are large and classically decorated. I have stayed here many times and have never been disappointed. You cant beat the location. Between 5th Avenue and Madison. The best shopping in the US. Close to central park. I threw a wonderful event there and the staff couldn't be more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and grand deco”
Reviews.Author: winterbirds
Reviews.Content: We booked the St Regis because a colleague has been raving about it, so we had high expectations before the trip. The location and the hotel itself is grand and luxurious, the check-in staff very polite and helpful, even though I am surprised by the small size of the lobby, and the almost non-existence of the doorman (when we checked out, I overhead one customer complained that he's been waiting for 20 mins for someone to take out his luggage from his limo, we didn't have such problem as we took the luggage into the hotel ourselves!). Although this is a minor problem, IMO. The room itself is of good size (esp for New York) and nicely decorated, but if you're into more chic and modern deco, this is not it, it's all old school glamour. The bathroom is the best part of the room - very luxurious and spacious, marble everywhere. The bed is comfy. The much talked about Butler service is OK, he/she (not fixed) would bring tea/coffee for you, iron your clothes and shine your shoes etc. However, I find all these "personal contact" a bit tiring and to be honest - just another excuse for tipping... It's definitely a great hotel, but I am not sure if all these warrant the kind of price they are charging. If you are paying $700-1000 a night, there are other better options, I believe.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better...”
Reviews.Author: boston344
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a quick trip to NY with my mother and a friend to celebrate her 60th b-day. We decided to use some points and stay at the St. Regis after we found that all the other starwood hotels were booked for the three nights (4-5-6-7) From all the great reviews about the St. Regis, I was excited! Here's the lowdown: The Good: 1) Location (if you want to do mega shopping aka. chanel, LV and if you want to see big touristy places like the empire and rockafeller)-which we did none of bc this is my millionth trip to ny. 2) The butlers. These people were SO very nice and attentive. They would bend over backward if you asked, and they all had amazingly funny, friendly personalities-yet never intruded, or pressed for money. We had Hong, Albert, Adelberto and two other men. 3) The beds! We stayed in the largest of the Grand Luxe rooms and the beds were great. Super plush and clean....somewhat small thought for a double in American standards(could only fit one person). 4) The bathrooms. If I could have brought this home, I would have! Pretty large for Manhattan standards, marble everything, Lcd and phone and a "rainforest" like shower with amazing water pressure. The bath products from their spa work incredibly well, too! 5) We did not hear one thing our entire stay. No other guests, just the ringing of our doorbell as the butler came to bring things. Very peaceful and calming. The Bad 1) We had to change rooms because there was not enough space for three adult people. We reserved a grand luxe (all they had) with two double beds. We asked for an upgrade but they said they were all sold out. When we got into the room, the beds were much smaller than standard US sized doubles, and only could comfortably fit one adult. They did offer a roll away free of charge each night for the confusion. 2) Awful reception (both internet and cell phone). My mother has verizon and our friend has At&t. Verizon got NO service, and at&t got light service. So annoying. 3) Service in general in the lobby as a bit poorer than expected for that class of hotel. Doormen were only stationed at one entrance, bell men were spotty and sometimes not available and we took our own bags from our room to the lobby when leaving. The feel of the hotel was a bit snobby. Many guests were dripping with designer products, in and out of luxury cars and no one EVER smiled or said hello! I didn't get it. There was virtually no lobby (probably to deter people from the streets to come in to use the bathroom). The whole hotel had a heavy european influence with a lot of gold and and chandeliers. Not my personal taste, but for some I bet this was luxurious. One amazing thing the St Regis did do, was order a cake for our friend to be brought to our room after dinner. I gave our butler little notice, maybe 4 hours, and when he brought it up, he said that the hotel had to send away for it because they had no cakes on hand to my specification. So nice! Obv. it cost an arm and leg, but well worth it. Overall, I would not choose to stay here again. I prefer the lower east side, greenwich Village and battery park to midtown bc midtown is so very touristy, but it was definitly NOT awful. One word of advice, don't order food from the hotel room service! A child size hamburger without any sides at all or drink cost $30 oops! Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Now I'm Spoiled”
Reviews.Author: deeann622
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of experiencing the high level of service and attention to detail during my stay at the St Regis. I was lucky to stay on the concierge level which included a butler. WOW!! We were initially greeted by our butler, then escorted to our room which had a fresh fruit and water waiting for us. Perfect after being out in the city all day. The bathroom was beautiful and the television in the bathroom was a nice touch. We took advantage of the courtesy car to take us to our dinner destination, Whym. We had breakfast downstairs and again service and food was top notch. What a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Makes you feel very special!”
Reviews.Author: FulhamMan
Reviews.Content: I had some spare SPG points to use and wanted to spend a few days in NYC. My head said stay at the cool and funky 'W', but for some reason I was attracted to the potentially stuffy St Regis. Well, that was one good decision... The entrance is unassuming. Inside you are immediately at peace, protected from the noisy and rush of the city. The hall staff are helpful and engaging (even to an SPG guest!) The check-in staff escorted me in the lift to my floor. There I was greeted by my concierge who offered to unpack and press my clothes. I declined, so instead he trotted off and brought me a superb tray of tea and biscuits. I felt like a proper Englishman in New York! The room was traditionally decorated to a very high standard - the bed was extremely comfortable and had luxurious fabrics. The bathroom was a treat - at first sight, it looked rather 20's retro, but the function was truly contemporary, with a fabulously powerful shower cubicle. The bath products were my personal favourite, Acqua di Parma - always a good choice to suit both men and women. The good service continued for the length of my stay and I was really quite sad to leave to return to the UK. Definitely on my 'must return' list and would be my top pick next time I go back to NTC.

Reviews.Title: “The best in New York”
Reviews.Author: WheatStacker
Reviews.Content: Whenever I have stayed here, I leave convinced it's the best hotel in New York, the service is amazing, the turn of the century details excellent, the furnighings are great and the maid and butler service are outstanding. I

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Sariano
Reviews.Content: Without any doubts this is the best hotel in New York City. The service is outstanding, from the porters to the personal butler that will accomodate to every request. The rooms are luxurious, the location fantastic. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: RitzCarltonfan
Reviews.Content: We visit New York frequently, at least twice a year and every time we chose the St. Regis Hotel for our luxury long weekend. With a location that cannot be beat (except of course for the Peninsula right across the street), the St. Regis offers a location at 55th Street East and 5th Avenue. From the moment you enter the lobby, it is like being transformed into a whole new world of old world charm and luxury. The rooms or suites (we have had both) are extremely spacious and have recently been re-done. The butler service is naturally St Regis and are extremely helpful in securing theatre tickets or restaurant reservations. The restaurants in the St Regis are wonderful already though, Alain Ducasse is a wonderful experience for a nice dinner and the Astor Court for afternoon tea or breakfast is the best place in the city. There are several nice restaurants within walking distance of the hotel also. The Remede Spa is fantastic, the treatments are customized for you (by your therapist) and a 60 minute massage is heaven. We will always continue to return to this fine establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Luxury”
Reviews.Author: travelholic02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The St. Regis New York from the 2nd May for 3 nights. It was our first time visit to the Hotel and New York. There was no draw back staying here. The fact is that it completely spoils you from staying anywhere else. It has a perfect position at 5th Avenue 55th Street which allows you to be out of the hussel and bussel , but within walking distance to central park and shopping centre. The hotel itself is beautiful, very classy and luxurious. The bedrooms are sumptuious with almost every amenity. No tea or coffee making facilities in the room but you get free coffee and tea from your butler at arrival and with wake up calls. From the crisp white bedlinen, to the gorgeous marble bathrooms,it is literally a dream to stay here. On this, our first visit, there was a complimentry canapes in our room in the evening. the St. Regis certainly go out of their way to make you feel special . My butler helpful enough to prepare my bath, so after a long soak in the deepest bath ever I recovered from my long flight. I defy anyone not to like The St. Regis New York, its one of the most famous , luxurious hotels in the world, whats not to like...........!

Reviews.Title: “My own butler need I say more...”
Reviews.Author: Binionbabe
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the St. Regis Hotel in Ny. The personal service is always the best. I was staying at the Cooper Square Hotel in Noho for a few days prior to the St. Regis due to my friends party. I wanted to try out Peter Luger's but the concierge there couldn't get me in. So I figured try the St. Regis and they did manage to get me a reservation even though I was staying at another hotel. They also recommended a resturant called Blue Hill and made us a reservation which I noted was most likely very coveted. The place was packed with people waiting. The food was to die for!! Standing ovation to the concierge at the St. Regis!! They even charged up my cell phone for me at 5am when I needed it. My butler Marcus at the St. Regis was sooo nice. It's the little things to me that make for a memorable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Sets the Standard”
Reviews.Author: SBCCA
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in six St. Regis hotels....US and Asia...and the New York original definitely sets the standard. You've read the other reviews...outstanding service, rooms, location, etc. What always surprises me is the easy friendliness of the staff. I always expect a New York City arrogant condescension. (Perhaps I anticipate a visit to Rosings and treatment from Lady Catherine de Burgh.) Just the opposite. The staff makes the hotel feel like home...relaxing instead of stiff. Just wish I could afford to stay there more often. Quite an amazing place. (Now, if some of the other St. Regis hotels would just start living up to this standard!) Oh, yes. Don't miss ordering a room service breakfast. That's how it should be done!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect. Why stay anywhere else in New York?”
Reviews.Author: Fsuga
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights beginning of March during the snow storm and could not possibly be any happier. Service was ridiculously good, starting with the doormen in top hats and tails, all the way through to our butler. I love the small yet gorgeous lobby as its size pretty much discourages other tourists from walking around and hanging out in it as they tend to do at the Plaza or Waldorf. Somehow, the doormen knew my name when I pulled up at the hotel the first time, must have been the last guest to check-in I guess. Check-in itself is very quick and when I gave the girl my Starwood number, she instantly offered me an upgrade to a suite, even though I probably have 4 Starwood stays over the last 2 years. That was nice. Was taken to the room by the same girl who was explaining the layout on the ride up to the 18th floor. We were met there by the butler who offered to press 2 garments from each of us gratis and complimentary shoe-shine and coffe/tea. First class place. The bathroom products are from the Remede spa downstairs and are probably as good as you can get in a hotel bathroom. I'll admit, I kept one of everything each day. The bed was insanely comfortable with real down comforters and pillows. All you have to do is ask if you want some nice memory foam pillows as well. Turndown service includes a fresh bucket of ice, 2 robes, 2 sets of surprisingly comfortable slippers, fresh fruit, curtains pulled, lights dimmed, and nice classical music set. You must take advantage of the complimentary tea service in the mornings. Bone china served on a silver tray, delivered with 3 newspapers. I LOVED the honey flavored swizzle sticks they send along instead of sugar. Seriously nice touch. We were treated as if we were hedge fund execs who stay there all the time, even though I secured the room when lastminutetravel.com had their $1 hotel room sale. I was expecting indifferent service from them to be honest, seeing as I paid $4 total, but they all couldn't have been nicer. Location is A+ perfect. Tiffany, central park, Bergdorff, St. Patrick's, subway, all within 2 or 3 blocks. Great place on the SW corner of the block with freshly made bagels and a stunning fruit/salad bar. Getting a taste for this place has ruined me. I won't stay anywhere else in NY again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: doublebooked
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the St Regis for 2 nights during a weekend. The reception in the hotel was as expected from a hotel of this class; the doorman asked our name upon arrival and we were greeted by our name whenever we left or came in. The check-in was pleasant, we received an upgrade to a suite and, surprisingly, we were brought to our room by the person who checked us in. Shortly thereafter the butler arrived to explain the mechanics in the room and she immedialty checked whether we needed dinner reservations (which she obtained at Adour, in the hotel for that evening). Throughout our stay the service was excellent. The room was classicaly decorated, very comfortable and spacious. Coffee and tea service was complimentary and apeeared shortly after calling the butler. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel but had dinner in Adour (Alain Ducasse) which was excellent, both service and food, but what else do you expect when the chef has several Michelin star restaurants. On our second day we asked the doorman for a taxi to the restaurant we had a reservation for, but instead of hailing a cab he called the St Regis Bentley for us; a very pleasant surprise. The hotel is very conveniently located between 5th Avenue (corner) and Madison Avenua and 3 blocks from Central Park. We have stayed in several other hotels in NYC, and althougfh there are many other cheaper and great alterantives, this was by far our best experience and highly recommended for a special event.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wrldtrav
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful Hotel. This is the most like a European style luxury hotel in the US..and we have been to a few. The houskeeping service was seamless and attentive to every detail. Everything about our room and bath was luxury.We have and will go back. Our only complaint is a big one. The food and service in the Astor Court dining room for breakfast was sub standard. The omelettes were tasteless. The coffee was weak. And for such pedestrian fare the prices were extraordinarily high ($133). When we entered the dining room at 10AM, almost all the tables had dirty dishes on them. We were not alone in our dissatisfaction. The table next to us waited for 30 minutes for a bowl of oatmeal.

Reviews.Title: “Never had better service”
Reviews.Author: UCLAboardr
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the St. Regis San Francisco and never thought I would experience better service but the St. Regis NYC has certainly done just that. I arrived on a redeye from Los Angeles and showed up at the hotel at 6:45am. They took my cell phone number and said they would try to ready a room for me within the next several hours. The hotel called me before 10am and said they had a room ready for me. They upgraded me to a deluxe room #1411 (not sure if being a SPG gold member had anything to do with it). I was staying only for 1 night and I booked the room using SPG points. The room was very spacious for a Manhattan hotel. The butler service was amazing -- brought me unlimited bottles of water and of took my shoes for a shining and brought them back within an hour. Even thought my room faced 55th street, it was unbelieveably quiet for a Manhattan hotel. I had a wonderful stay. The location on 5th avenue is perfect. The hotel also gave me a 4pm late checkout the next day. Everyone from the bell desk to the folks working at the front desk are incredibly nice and bend over backwards to ensure your stay is perfect. If you can afford it, I feel that there is not other place to stay in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but old-fashioned”
Reviews.Author: ceo_nomad
Reviews.Content: Looking at its website before arriving, I was worried about not liking the St Regis. In general, I do not like classical-style hotels in the US, but the excellent service and very comfortable rooms won me over. The St Regis is an exceptionally well-run hotel with fantastic staff in a perfect New York location. For this style of hotel in NY, I still prefer the Peninsula but it is a very close race. Right from the moment I arrived, everyone was unfailingly friendly and polite: nothing was too much trouble, and every single person who met me greeted me with a cheerful smile. The butler service was much more practical and useful than other hotels I have stayed at: the butler was very friendly and seemed to take a great personal pride in sorting out whatever you requested. Room service breakfast was excellent, and good value compared to other NY five star places. The rooms themselves do the very best they can around the old bones of the hotel. They are decorated in a clean, classical style--my Astor Suite was in a muted yellow with silk wall panels, while my colleague's Grand Luxe room was in a light duck egg blue. Both were good sizes and well laid out, with classical marble bathrooms that are a good size and well-equipped. The Astor Suite suffered from the very small windows you get on the top floors of the building, but in return for that the views were good. For me, given the hotel's short height and location, none of the views are spectacular: just nice views up and down the grand streets. The Grand Luxe room was much brighter, but you only really saw the fronts of other buildings from the windows. All the facilities worked excellently, as expected at this level. Good high-speed internet and excellent climate control in both rooms. Given this and the fact that all services are 24h, it makes a great hotel for business travellers as well as a luxurious place for a holiday. Value-wise it's very expensive but on a par with the other five star places in NY. I only stayed for one night but I definitely want to go back and try the place again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Stay...”
Reviews.Author: Isibet
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a 3 night stay at the St Regis Hotel earlier this month. This is our annual fall trip to NYC. Once again the hotel staff were wonderful and every single request was handled promptly and with no issues... I stayed with my wife and 2 little boys in a 1 bedroom suite that was just lovely, roomy, and luxurious. This time around we found the butler helpful and will to address our every need. The restaurant, though a bit on the expensive side, was excellent. The food was wonderful and the service was excellent. Is the St Regis expensive?.....YES!!..even by NYC standards...is it worth it?...absolutely! Unless we get priced out...we will always return to the St Regis every fall.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great weekend...”
Reviews.Author: elt1015
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Regis this weekend on our starwood points. It was WONDERFUL. We requested either ajoining rooms or side by side rooms, since we were traveling with our three children. We were more than please to find rooms ajoined in a suite. The rooms were beautiful, butler service was excellent, and beds are soooo cozy. King Cole bar downstairs was also a lot of fun. Hotel is in a perfect location. We travel to NYC often and usually stay at the Four Seasons, but I think we will only stay at the St Regis now!!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance,Style Comfort and more”
Reviews.Author: Earthman83
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here in July. Having phoned prior,the concierge had confirmation of restaurant bookings waiting in our room. We had a butler and she was amazing.I needed my suit pressed in a hurry after a long day travelling and she had it back to me in 30 minutes! The rooms are Grand in a European (think Paris) style and just so neat. The room daily service was great as was turn down with plenty of water left out and fresh fruit. I highly recommend their special recipe french toast for breakfast , it's unusual and very very tasty!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovegoodhotels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a standout, from the luxurious common areas, to the beautifully decorated French neoclassical rooms. We stayed in a Grand Luxe room which included a couch and living area and a plasma t.v. that would pop up from the foot of the bed by remote control. It swiveled around so that we could watch t.v. either from the living area or the bed. The bathroom had a separate soaking tub and a shower, as well as a dual vanity. The butler would bring in fresh fruit every day and upon request delivered complimentary coffee and tea in the morning hours. Each floor has it's own butler, so there is never much of a wait. The hotel is in an excellent location, right near Park and Fifth Ave.. Designer shopping is around the corner and Central Park is within walking distance. It was exciting to see the thriving city of New York from one of the best parts of downtown Manhattan. The rooms were always very clean and the staff would leave them a bit perfumed after servicing them each day. The service in this hotel was excellent and unobtrusive. Each request was granted quickly and efficiently. I wanted to give this hotel the five stars it should deserve but gave it four for the following reasons. First of all, the room had no light. It was always dark, even during the day. The only rooms with light were on the top floor. Second, except for the new restaurant by Alan Ducaisse, the food was only average and that includes in room dining and at their restaurant near the lobby. Third, the spa, while having good actual massage treatments, had no real waiting area. In the hallway that leads to the treatment rooms, two chairs are set up for people waiting for their massages. You can't make any noise because the people receiving their massages are in doors right behind you. Two other people came for their massage while we were there and there was no room for them to wait anywhere. The last problem had to do with the noise, which really wasn't the fault of the St. Regis. Every night we were there, a heavy garbage truck screeched through the streets of Manhattan to pick up some type of garbage. On Monday night, it was regular garbage, on Tuesday, it was recyclables, Wednesday it was organic materials. They would operate between 12:00 midnight and 2:15 a.m., which made it very difficult to sleep. I think this is just part of being in Manhattan. Other than these problems, this hotel is exceptional, especially in beauty and service. I would not let any of the problems I mentioned stop me from staying here again. -Except that I might try to get a room on a higher floor!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: aventurer
Reviews.Content: Great stay! Impeccable service. Our room was very spacious although it did not have a view. However, we enjoyed the peace and quiet. The bathroom was beautiful with separate shower / toilet / tub areas. Worth every penny (and not a bad deal with the 50% off from Starpoints). The butler on each floor is a nice touch and we enjoyed the truly fresh fruit. Would stay there again. Good location, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: rjmartintx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights using Starwood Points and used it as our base to attend the U.S. Open tennis matches. Service was superb and the room, complete with a large, swiveling, LCD TV concealed in a pop-up box at the end of the bed, was exquisite. Since we arrived just after lunch, our room was not quite ready. One of the managers walked us into the bar and offered us complimentary drinks while we waited. They came for us about 20 minutes later and escorted us to our room and to meet our floor's butler. She was delightful, offered to unpack our suitcases for us (really, now?!), offered to press any items of clothes for us, and explained how we could page her in the mornings for coffee. Complimentary coffee is brought in the mornings on a silver tray, with china cups, served very hot in a French press. (At night, however, the same request results in a room service charge.) It sure beats making coffee in a dinky pot in the bathroom! Of all of the hotels we've stayed at in the United States and Europe, this ranks among the best.

Reviews.Title: “hotel with attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: clement12
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel 2 nights for business because i had to be close to 5th avenue. wonderful stay. the room was great. the decoration very relaxing. comfortable high bed. the butlers were excellent and very nice. michael i think his name is very friendly. the attention for detail is wonderful. the only less nice thing is the doormans had problems with caring with cars and taxis. but in general, my stay was wonderful. there restaurant adour was amazing. i ate at alain ducasse restaurant louis XV in monaco and wanted to try his in new york. beautiful. delicious. i got the service i payed for. please keep the good job going.

Reviews.Title: “adooooored our stay”
Reviews.Author: ParisLondoner
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights with 2 kids 5 and 8. We felt so welcome by the warm staff (butler, concierge, groom, waiter...) we cannot wait to return. We used to stay at the Four Seasons but fell so anonymous last time we wanted a change. Well, we were right : Everybody greeted us in a very personal way and all seemed to remember our names and our children's. Had a great suite with 2 bathrooms and great views. Well, everything was so perfect, we are dreaming to come back from Paris ! The St Regis definitly lives up to its reputation...

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: MeFuzzyBear
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend at the St. Regis in NYC. I was not overly impressed by the hotel. The first night we checked in we were given a room on a lower floor - with absolutely no view (except for an exterior wall). We were moved the second night, but our room was only half the size. The butler service was a nice touch, except when we tried to utilize the service, the butler did not respond until 20 minutes later. We did enjoy the bed and linens - they were nice. I was disappointed that some of the other aspects of the hotel were not up to par...such as the very low water pressure, broken hairdryer, smoking-smell on the non-smoking floors... In summary, this was still a nice hotel in a good location (close to 5th Avenue shopping & Central Park)...but for the price, I would definitely stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic!”
Reviews.Author: newyorklover123
Reviews.Content: Went with friends to look at universities and shopping! Also saw Mary Poppins which was unbelievable! The location is great at 55 and 5 ave. The suite with connecting room was huge and new! The service was the best in new york for dining, theatre, and transportation. The Astor Court serves a fabulous afternoon tea, best in NY and the Alain Ducasse restaurant is perfect for the fine dinner!

Reviews.Title: “A Palace in NYC”
Reviews.Author: nickelass
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. I recently booked it for 1 special night, as I was proposing to my girlfriend. I live in NY and had considered the other great hotels (The Ritz, The Mandarin), but I couldn't have been more pleased that I chose this hotel for our special stay. I booked a Grand Luxe room, but when I told the front desk host my plans, she immediately upgraded us to an enormous Madison Suite on the 18th floor. We were amazed by the beauty and sheer size of the room, with an enormous living room, fireplace, and 2 full-size marble bathrooms. They even arranged rose petals in the room for us. I did have a couple of service requests throughout our stay, and after I paged our butler through the in-room control center, my requests were quickly met. The next morning we decided to order breakfast, even though it was incredibly pricey. When we checked out with the same front desk host who checked us in the day before, she ended up comping the pricey breakfast, for no other reason than to congratulate us! I can't say enough nice things about this hotel and the service staff, and I know that my fiance and I will return here for many special occasions in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: eoetourhost
Reviews.Content: Booked two nights at the St. Regis for my wife's birthday midweek using Starwood points. Arrived to find I was upgraded to a Madison Suite with two full baths and 875 square feet total including views of 5th and 55th streets. Received complimentary Champagne and sweets. Also got requested 3P.M. late checkout. If you can find fault with this hotel you need to get a life!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Luxury”
Reviews.Author: saint22
Reviews.Content: It was our 10th wedding Anniversary and I wanted to do something special for my beautiful wife so I booked a room at the St. Regis for one night on the Friday of Memorial Day weekend. I booked the Astor Suite for our stay. I also booked a custom massage for my wife and myself. The Concierge was able to get us a dinner reservation at Daniel and everything was in place for a wonderful trip. We drove in from Connecticut and arrived at the St. Regis at 12:15 p.m.. We took advantage of the valet parking and our bags were taken care of smartly by the very professional doormen working the sidewalk. We we're greeted very warmly and we followed the porter inside to the magnificent lobby. We proceeded to guest registration to check-in. I was greeted warmly by the woman checking us in and she told us because of our early arrival, our room was still occupied. However, she said she had a very nice room for us, a very, very, nice room. She handed me the key cards to our room and we were shown around the hotel by a very charming young woman. We were then taken to the elevator and we proceeded to the 18th floor. We got off the elevator went through the french doors, turned left and proceeded to the end of the hall and there was our room. Room 1803 is also known as the Imperial Suite and we were led inside by our butler. The Imperial Suite was gorgeous. You walk into a marble floored foyer with fresh flowers in a vase on the table. We turned left and proceeded to a beautiful bedroom with french antiques and crystal chandalier over the bed. The marble master bathroom was exquisite and spacious. On the other side of the foyer was the living room with two large circular windows. The oval window looked out to the west on 5th Avenue and the Peninsula Hotel across the Avenue. The other round window faced north with a breathtaking view up 5th Avenue with the trees of Central Park verdant in the distance. Next to the living room was an elegant dining room with a six foot round mahogany table surrounded by six elegant chairs. Off the dining room was a full kitchen with granite countertops. Beyond the dining room was a rich paneled study in the most handsome, masculine wood with a beautiful wood desk and chair. The Imperial Suite also had a total of two and one half baths, four flat screen TVs, crystal chandaliers in every room and luxurious empire furniture. I kidded my wife that I felt like french royalty in this fabulous suite. I could have sat on the padded window seat looking out over Central Park for hours. We left and walked over to MoMA. After about three hours at MoMA, we returned and dressed in only our slippers and robes went down to the Spa and were treated royally with our massages. My masseuse was wonderful. My wife reported that her masseur was also fantastic. We returned to our suite and I decided to take a bath. It was a perfect compliment to the massage. I was totally relaxed. We got dressed for dinner and the doorman hailed us a cab and we were whisked away to Daniel for dinner. What a fabulous restaurant. The food, the presentation and the service were all incredible. After dinner, we decided to walk back to the hotel since it wasn't that far and it was a beautiful spring evening in the city. We returned to the St. Regis and walked into the King Cole Bar for a drink. After a round of Red Snappers and catching up with my cousin the artist and musician who met us there, I told my cousin that he had to see our room. He had been to many 5 star hotels throughout Europe and he said he had never seen such a great suite. After he left, my wife and I sat on the padded window seat and took in the city from our big round window. The bed was like sleeping on a cloud and our bedroom was quiet and peaceful. We awoke the next morning and unfortunately had to check out. What a fabulous experience. We will never forget our stay at the St. Regis

Reviews.Title: “Glad I experienced it; would choose a different hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: epilogue
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for my birthday (a special one); he knew I wanted to experience the hotel at some point in my life. He tried to book a suite but was told that there were none available but not to worry---the room would be the best of the rest. He also wanted tickets to South Pacific and was told that the seats, though terribly expensive, would be the best in the house. He also asked to book a private boat for a Sunday morning Hudson River ride... When we arrived, the greetings and help from the doormen and front desk staff just weren't what we expected from this class of hotel. (I had just stayed at the Ritz Central Park South the month before, where the service was absolutely 5 star, and I could see the difference immediately). The room the butler brought us to faced a wall. We asked for another, and they offered a far better room, but at that point, I was wishing we had booked the Ritz. As we vacillated, the butler said the Madison Suite would be available in a few hours if we wanted to wait. So we did. The Madison Suite was spacious, with a foyer, separate living room, and two baths. It was spotless and really quite lovely with all the old architectural details. No complaints at all. Maid service during the day was excellent; the room was always pristine when we returned. (At night, they always missed at least one thing..we stayed 3 nights total.) When we picked up the tickets for the show, they were *not* the best seats in the house. They were in the loge, not in the orchestra. My husband said no to them, which caused a bit of fluster. Ten minutes later, someone called the room saying there had been a mixup and the seats were now 500 dollars less, far more acceptable. So in the end, we experienced the show and loved it, but this is the kind of thing that adds up to a disappointing hotel experience overall... Also, no one ever followed up on the boat trip. Similarly, everyday service was always polite and friendly but spotty. Sometimes someone would be at the door, greeting you and pushing it open, other times you would have to wrestle with it (it's heavy) yourself. Sometimes someone would be at the elevator to ask you which floor; most of the time, not. It *was* nice to stay in a place with such history, built the way nothing is built nowadays, and I'm really glad I did, but I wouldn't stay here again. In that location, and for that price point, the service at the Ritz was far superior.

Reviews.Title: “5 star St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: Nikon70
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at a wonderful hotel. We arrived early and we were allowed to check in to a room that met all of my request. We only encountered one problem with the heat and it was rectified almost immediately once my husband spoke to the reservation staff. The next day, a box of french chocolates arrived with an invitation to enjoy a complementary breakfast. Needless to say we enjoyed both gifts. Looking forward to our next stay at the truly 5 star hotel with a 5 star staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy Street doesn't make up for the comfort”
Reviews.Author: Epicure3
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is luxurious, I just spent my second night on the fourth floor and was woken up at two by garbage trucks outside which loaded and beeped for an hour. My colleague got bumped up to a suite when she complained about her room. Avoid any rooms on low floors facing the street and you might get some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the NY St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: thurg8
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the NY St. Regis 3 times in the last year and have been very impressed with their consistent delivery of 5 star service and rooms. The rooms are beautiful and a great location along with personalized service from the friendly, helpful staff make it our favorite place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location and history”
Reviews.Author: 50somethingss
Reviews.Content: I can only concur with many other reviewers. A landmark hotel that is more than the sum of its parts. If you prefer "bling" then the Peninsula might suit better. The staff were very welcoming and I had the impression many had been working at the hotel for years. We felt at surprisingly at home here, despite the non-existant view from the room. An evening aperitif in the intimate, yet rather grand bar gave evenings a sense of occasion. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “You have to love the St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: DCTraveler45
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis truly sets the standard for hotel stays in New York City. Even the Ritz Carlton feels like a significant step down after staying here. Although it is very expensive, the hotel really does deliver with service that goes beyond the offerings of other luxury hotels. First, the rooms themselves always seem quite a bit larger than others I have stayed in in Manhattan. They tend to be decorated in a more opulent Victorian fashion as well (compared to other NYC hotel rooms that generally have a contemporary feel). Best of all, each room is assigned to a butler who will bring up tea or coffee, or help you with anything you need. The only negative experience I have ever had here (other than the price) is that the last time I asked, they did not have an ATM in the hotel, which seemed a bit odd and was a bit inconvenient. But, that is a small price to pay in my opinion as there is always an ATM within a block or so in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: lorionka
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this Hotel twice this year. Every time it was excellent! Once we have been upgraded to the Astor suite - spacious room, with fire place and separated living room. Next time we stayed in the deluxe room, which was very nice - beautifully decorate, good size room, big luxurious shower, and view to the streets. (Well only one window, but it was enough). The breakfast at the hotel is amazing. The breakfast room is beautifully furnished, the service and food excellent. (Very good orange juice). But it is also very expensive. For instance one American breakfast(eggs, potatoes, bacon, sausage or ham, juice, coffee, pastry basket) for 38dolars!!!! I recommend to share one American breakfast between two people. (the portions are huge)! People from front desk and concierge, very nice, very polite and helpful. Oh I had massage in the spa.. it was nice, but I think that the spa was ok. I expected more since every other services were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Upstairs, Downstairs.”
Reviews.Author: FelixRIP
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Saint Regis for 5 nights on Romance package. Grande Luxe room with breakfast. Absolutely fantastic hotel and location. Strarted with Limo pickup from JFK in a Merc and got better from there. Great clean and stylish room. Bit on the small side, but good for NY standards. Thought the beds at Peninsula Hong Kong couldnt be beat, Wrong, these beds are sublime. Arrived to a good quality bottle of French champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. Upstairs: Butler pretty much superfluous. Introduced themselves on arrival, only needed them once when my phone charger went missing (probably with the sheets and towels) they promised the earth and never appeared again. I went out and bought another next day (cant let lifes little dramas ruin a good holiday) Housekeeping staff very polite and friendly. Downstairs: Concierge and desk staff courteous and friendly, doormen sometimes efficient most times lazy and arrogant (but doormen the world over have chips on their shoulders) Breakfast with Marcos an absolute highlight. Knew our favourite table and requirements and made sure we had it every morning. A great way to start the day, a happy genuine smiling face and a concern for patrons. This is what 5 star service is really about, person to person interaction and respect. Treating the patrons the way they deserve to be treated when staying at the top hotel in New York. Fantastic location, some great staff, manificent rooms and sublime beds.

Reviews.Title: “St. Regis concierge team has only 5 star to offer.”
Reviews.Author: DirectorX
Reviews.Content: I was staying at this hotel during a business meeting. The concierge made all 5 star dinner arrangements, had the theatre tickets, referred me to the best bars and got a spectacular 5 star Limousine provided by CSL Transportation. [--]

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travlnmompa
Reviews.Content: Beautiful old hotel with updated ammenities that don't seem out of place. Wonderful service- we were traveling with our 6 & 5 year olds so service is everything! Great night sleep- not only was it the best bed I have ever slept in (inc. 4 seasons) the room was completely sound proof. We never heard a horn beep or footsteps outside our door. A very comfortable hotel I highly recommend it if you're staying in midtown. Also the housekeeping was great, we forgot our daughters blanket and they tracked it down for us.

Reviews.Title: “I looked out at the rats”
Reviews.Author: APJackson
Reviews.Content: This is fourth stay at St Regis and my last. I was there for work for four days and whilst I thought as a return guest, Starwood decent card holder and booked through Centurion I would be looked after, I was instead given a low floor, with a smell of cigarettes and with no view. It had one small window that looked out to a cement void that featured a regular rat looking for food. He became a daily friend. Getting a bad cold during the stay didn't help (when I wanted for some natural light as I slept it off). They did get me a housecall doctor which was great - but at $180. I guess that's fair. It is lovely hotel and the right room can make it a great hotel but they seem to play favourites and I wasn't one... I had a problem with my bill and this along with some other problems forced me to write my first ever complaint letter in a hotel. I never got a reply from the Manager I wrote too. What a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Sculpher
Reviews.Content: I was put up at the St Regis for 2 weeks by my company - I can't say when I've been treated better or enjoyed a stay more than this one. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: gnasty71
Reviews.Content: We wanted to celebrate our anniversary in style so we looked at a number of luxury hotels in NYC. St. Regis, Mandarin Oriental, Le Parker Meridian. The Mandarin was our first choice but they didn't have the availability. St Regis was a wonderful second. The ambience and decor is definitely old style luxury. Your are brought to your room and soon, your "butler" arrives to introduce you to the amenities of the room including a new touch screen control panel that controls everything. You can ask him for assistance with a number of things but we didn't use the butler service. We got a deluxe room with a very comfortable and plush king bed and sitting area. There is a flat screen tv that comes out of a stand by the foot of your bed for some relaxing in-bed TV. You can swivel the TV around so its facing the couch for viewing there as well. When you are done, press a button and TV lowers out of site. The bathrooms are clean and fancy as well. Definitely let them know if its a special occasion. We mentioned it was our anniversary and when we returned to our room, we found a small bottle of Veuve Cliquot champagne and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us. The only drawback is the steep price. I think we paid $850 + tax for the deluxe room. Its a hefty bill but no more so than the other 5 star luxury hotels in New York. It has a great location in midtown. Close to Central Park and 5th Avenue Shopping. The staff was very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Error prone luxury”
Reviews.Author: LosGatostraveler
Reviews.Content: In a super quiet oasis of Beaux Arts luxury in midtown Manhattan we experienced an error prone stay. After gratefully receiving an early check in and a spacious room we received a telephone call not to use the bathroom because there was a sewer problem which would be fixed "in a little while". Meanwhile we could go across the street to the Sony Center to use the bathroom. However, I was not feeling all that well and had to stay in our room waiting to be told the problem was over. After four hours we telephoned and were told it was all right now. I do not know if we would ever have been notified. In the evening, still not feeling well, I ordered room service and was told the "24 hour room service" would open at 7 pm. When I finally was able to order most of the items on the menu were not available due to " a problem in the kitchen". Meanwhile we attempted to find the Silver Sea cruise representative desk and were sent from one floor to the next looking for him. No one seemed to know where he was or when his desk was open. At breakfast the service in the dining room was forgetfull: toast but no bread plates or butter, an unasked for glass of truly awful carrot-ginger juice, a long wait for everything. Then when we checked out we were charged again for the breakfast, although at check-in we had verified that our rate included breakfast. After all these inconveniences we were not offered any complimentary items or compensation, which would have, perhaps, overcome the need to write this negative review of a truly beautiful old-world hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant if stuffy”
Reviews.Author: TonyTokyo
Reviews.Content: In NY for business, I stayed at the St Regis for about a month in total. It was consistently good, though the first room I was in was noticably larger and generally better than the second, which seemed to be in a less-recently-renovated part of the building. Small difference were present: the first room had a DVD player, so the second time I bought a DVD only to find the room only had a VCR. The beds are very comfortable, and the staff take their service levels very seriously - arguably a little too seriously for most people's comfort. It all attracts an overly self-satisfied crowd. Still, small details were annoying, like having the dry cleaning come back with everything steamed perfectly flat and proper, but with so much steam having been used that buttons on $500 shirts were cracked. Not just once or twice either. And returned as if nobody noticed, despite the careful folding and two or three layers of wrapping. Contrasts with a far cheaper hotel I stayed in in HK where my casual shirt came back unexpectedly with a missing button replaced and nicely sewn on. Breakfast was excellent, and an exceptionally pleasant way to start the day. All up, I can recommend it as a pleasant if stuffy retreat from the hectic city without, but don't take your good shirts.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Awesome”
Reviews.Author: kaltruck
Reviews.Content: This hotel in all it's magnifigence is way over the top, my son, his wife, children and myself stayed there for 5 nights. We had two rooms and were treated like royalty in every aspect of our stay. This awesome hotel's location is unbelieveable and within walking distance of everything you could imagine, just very topnotch. Thank you to my son and thank you to all the staff at St Regis that made my stay an unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “What do you get for $725 per night?”
Reviews.Author: 5*fan
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights at the St. Regis in January and, like other reviewers, found the hotel well situated with rooms furnished with comfotable beds, fine linens, and luxurious amenities. The comments about the hotel's tight lobby and rooms are all accurate, but what is most disturbing about a hotel at this price point is the disappointing service we experienced. Here are just a few examples - Upon check in, we were informed that we would be provided with a bottle of wine and cheese platter in honor of a special occasion. During our stay, this never arrived. We also dined in the hotel's restaurant for breakfast and afternoon tea. The service during both did not impress. To the hotel's credit, the tea was delicious, but we were unable to finish all the sweets and asked for a box to take them to our room. The waiter offered to deliver them and we accepted this offer. The sweets did not arrive until several hours later and we charged for them at checkout. After two nights at the St. Regis, we decided to leave the hotel early and see if the similarly-priced Penninsula would deliver a better experience (it did - see review). While hotels in NYC can be expensive, those at the upper end of the price range should deliver at all levels. Because the St. Regis failed to deliver the type of service we expected, we will choose another hotel when we return to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “An Elegant Past for a Modern Present”
Reviews.Author: MJPBAF
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the flagship St. Regis hotel in New York City in February 2007. What a wonderful stay – we’d go back again in a minute. This hotel boasts a kind of hushed elegance that strikes just the right counterbalance to the hustle and bustle of New York City. The location, on Fifth Avenue in the mid-50s, is far enough away to avoid the crowds of the theater district but close enough to make getting around simple and straightforward. The lobby and public spaces are both grand and intimate and the hallways are hushed and elegant. The flowers and fine decoration everywhere make it seem the height of luxury.
